I belong to a small town so whatever i achieved after moving outside of my town was big for me.  I left my home for study when i was just 14-15 years old to prepare for IIT and AIEEE. Since then with continuous hardwork and support of my family, i have achieved so many things which i never imagined of.   1. Before going to prepare for IIT and AIEEE, i didn't have any idea about these exams. As i was good in study so one of our relative suggested to prepare for these exams.  I secured AIR - 16752 in IIT-JEE and AIR - 14266 in AIEEE in first attempt and I got admission in NIT jamshedpur.  2. In final year, i was placed in L&T construction. At that time, it was biggest achievement for me as basic motto of my life was to support my family financially.  3. As the basic motto of my life was to support my family financially so i never thought of preparing for ESE and GATE but my manager in L&T was an A** h***. His behavior forced me to quit the job and this was very crucial for me as the basic Motto of my life was failed here. But somehow my family managed it and after 1 year of hardwork i secured AIR 11 in GATE 2018 and was selected for all the major PSU's JOB. Basic motto again fulfilled.  4. I also appeared for ESE along with GATE and it's result was announced when i was working in ONGC and i secured AIR-62 in it. I resigned from ONGC and Currently i am working as an Assistant Director in Central Water Commission under Ministry of Jal Shakti.  5. Along with all these things, the respect that me and my family has earned in these years is unimaginable.   So this is my journey from AIR-16752 to AIR-62 or i can say from a small town boy to an Officer in Central Government.  Thanq for reading !!

My greatest achievement in my life was writing my book. I have always wanted to write a book but thought I could never do. I came from a very abusive family where my dad made sure I didn’t do my homework or read my school books. I graduated from high school barely passing. I could hardly comprehend reading or write well. Felt like I was graduating from middle school than high school. When my past haunted me, I started writing to get the trauma out of my head. I was no longer able to suppress it anymore, and was told that I was weak if turned for help. There were times I didn’t know where I was or what I was doing. I was even not sure the time period. My book is done entirely by myself: the writing, the editing, the formatting, and the designing. I took my book off the market so I could change the title and edit it better. In May of this year, I will put it out on the market. Then work on two books along the children stories for my children book. The two books will be out this year. They are already written but need to do the editing. I wanted to show others that even deprived of a proper education, anything was possible if one put her mind to it. My new book title: In the Jungle My home during the Vietnam War Old title: On my Own How I survived the Vietnam War I finally got something that I have always wanted, and it made up for the hard life I lived thru: I could draw. I never drew anything my entire life. One day, I looked at someone’s drawing that he was going to use for wood carving. No telling myself that I couldn’t do it. I just grabbed a pencil and drew it in two hours. In a month I drew things that would take someone a year to do. I felt as if God finally gave me something to make up my suffering from the Vietnam War and severe child abuse.

I think it was adopting Ethiopian and Mayan Guatemalan babies. Both are girls, seven years old and nine years old, and at the top of their class in both private school and a public magnet school. On a larger social level, I ran a program that had 1100 apartment buildings and 110,000 tenants with a $110M that were abandoned by the owners in New York City. The prior winter 12 people froze to death in those buildings, there was very little sanitation, heat and they had turned into the worst of the worst. For three years I restructured management, hired three dozen Ivy League management graduates, and threw a number of people in jail. I also formed a Participatory Management scheme for the 3200 employees. The best part is no one died from freezing or sanitation issues, and it was the beginning of turning around neighborhoods. I am not bragging, but I am very proud of what everyone involved accomplished.

My friend and myself often argued about using the name “Marksman” as our official gaming name. We decided to make a final decision by using “Tomb Raider 2013” as our jury. Why Tomb Raider 2013 ?  Neither of us have ever played that game because the story line isn’t much intriguing and terrible graphics as well. So here’s the rules we played with to gain the virtual “Marksman” title. Not more than 5 times , the character must die.Collectibles and other quests not mandatory.Weapons : Bow and HandGunThe winner with maximum head shots win.Non Human entity kills don’t count.Lara Croft will be remembered as one of my favorite games ever because my every kill was a head shot (Definitely not the wolves though). I will ask him to support my answer soon. Is this your biggest achievement in life ? Definitely not, but it will always be there in my Top 10. Marksman.

I belong from a mediocre family with lots of problems in early phases of life. I used to go to school by walking 10 K.M per day. We had not a bicycle to cater our study. We had not taken our meal to eat in recreation time. There was not a person to guide in our study and career. Mother had arrenged a tuition master, to whom we had been paying tuition fee after harvesting of peddy. She had great expectation that study is the vital instrument to make a drastic change in someone lives. It is a universal truth too. Frankly speaking we were lacking of the basic needs of life. We had hardly enough for survival. As you know time heals everything. Time flies and my study was going on. As a lower class people we had not a concrete particular goal in life. I had just a aim to get a Government Job and to be a reason of my parents happiness. I began to prepare for a government job since after my post graduation. I devoted the best I could in my preparation. I had been giving competitive examination, fortunately after one and half year of preparation I got a Government clerical job in the District Administration. My parents became happy so as me. But the harsh reality was that I had not enough salary to boost up my family condition. The dependent and to do list was large. The same principle was applied once again to devote time on study to get a gob at higher level. In this time my dream had been specific, the only job I had to crack was of my parential subject specific. Fortunately, I did it once again with my labor and devotion. Now, my parents and siblings are happy. I have now the ability to make them happy and to fill their long awaited dream to avail the basic need of life. “ Hard work, dedication and sincerity pay back with overloaded happiness. Have a clear vision and go on. Once you decide to achieve anything in your life, you are unstoppable” This is my first answer on quora. Your sincere correction will be highly appreciated.

To answer the question about my best achievement in life one would have to tell me what is the most important aspect in my life. I would break it down to three major areas. Academic, work and love. This is the first time I think about it. Academically somebody called me an over achiever. I take it as an insult. I was a high achiever, but it did not come with great difficulty. Actually I only got a masters degree, but instead of going for Phd I opted to lean accounting and get a designation beside my science degree. So academically I was a high achiever. At work I had management positions as high as being the chief financial officer for the entire Canadian part (several plants) of an international organization. So, I guess my working career was also successful. What about love? I was happily married to my first and only love for 64 years. Actually we were engaged before being married for 3 years. So it is a 87–68 years of deep and true love affair. So was my life successful? It all seems to me like a beautiful dream. Was it really true? I lost my husband, the love of my life almost a year ago. Now I am a lonely 85 year old woman. Retired from my job over 65 years ago. Nobody knows me there any more. And academics? Trying to see what is new in science since I graduated. In one word: everything. Theoretical physics hardly existed, it was all classical. And there are new branches of mathematics to support the new physics. So much for a successful life!

This may sound cliché to many but I can honestly answer that my kids is the best achievement in my life and though I'm not yet 30 I am certain that they will be my best achievement in life full stop. No matter what personal goals/achievements I go on to accomplish or have previously achieved they will never top that of my children :) I am also married and like many others our marriage hasn't came without it's good and bad times, and I believe it is a testament to my husband and myself and the love we have for each other and our children that has helped us get through the bad and cherish and enjoy the good. Many of you may wonder why I chose my children and my marriage as my greatest achievements in my life and for me the answer is pretty simple. We are here for a short time, we come in to the world alone and go out the same way, however who we share our lives with and the family we have are the MOST important parts of our lives.After all what does any materials ever mean when we're no longer around?

Thanks Becky/Thomas/others for asking me a question that carries high value for me. It is interesting too because I had to a very tough life in my initial years. My father died at the age of 44 and I was hardly 12 then. From then on, I interfaced with adults and tried to earn a few morsels for myself. Thus from 1958 onward, I have managed to live an honorable life. A couple of months in 1958 as an apprentice artist in a press was the start. Then I was lucky to be sent to school for matriculation. In 1962, I did a clerical job for four months before joining government service in 1963 as telegraphist. I started my studies thereafter before deciding to become an engineer in my own department. The journey started from 1966 finally retiring in 2007. I am enjoying a pensioner’s life. I think my biggest achievement has been to STAY HONEST, HARDWORKING AND CONTRIBUTING INDIVIDUAL ALL ALONG without getting negative tags and labels even for a smallest misdoing. This is not easy to do; I rode merrily on divine support, and that is a great achievement from my point of view.

I have plenty of non-life changing achievements. Success with hobbies, milestones in athletic pursuits, academic victories etc. There are three accomplishments that stand out in my life so far. First is that I've managed to amass many good friendships that will never ever tarnish and still no true enemies. Second is that I grew up with a verbally abusive and alcoholic dad, with an older brother who has aspergers. It was for a long time, a rough household to live in. Third was overcoming severe ADHD — symptoms after coming off of over a decade of gradually increased medication. Doing a backfill or 30 pull ups or memorizing 100 digits of pi were all fun things to achieve (oh yes i did) but those three things above were the most critical to my life and who I really am. But hopefully my next achievement will be getting a million dollars and buying a Sick AF Villa house.

When asked about achievements, we do relate it with our academics and yes why not, in today’s life the thing which is taking up maximum of us and eating our days is somehow related to academics. So to answer it, i was never a even ‘Fine’ kind of student in performing over in examinations, So keeping that in mind, Parents had a tough time with me everytime explaining me to study, which i did though, but never managed to grab good or even okie sort of grades. And as a result, When u’r living in an INDIAN society , everyone from ur milkman, to one of ur dear friend/relative judge u on basis of ur grades, do give their advice, without keeping in mind that may be advice does not cost them anything, but it is worth a lot, so not to give it like for granted… and make sure, if u give one, should be justified and surely u have examined the issue and put yourself in former person’s shoe first. So taking it back to the time when i aspired that i would like to have ‘Biology’ as a subject choosen after 10th and move ahead and work for becoming a Doctor, coz something in me was continously pushing me to choose it and work accordingly( as it was also a subconcious expectation of my Father).However the thought of having other subjects like maths or other streams of science deterred me from doing that. But still , crossing the expectation of my parents and performing better than that i got Grade I marks in the boards, for which i got praised and got to hear things like. “ this was never expectd of you” “ You performed good” etc etc, which at one place was giving me good feeling, but something in me asked me, did i just deserved this much even after doing and performing much better compared to the performances i gave earlier. Taking forward , i ended up taking, rather choosing ‘Commerce’ as my crib , not knowing to do ,what in future! But yes i worked hard, gave enough and performed quite better this time and got some decent percentage i.e. 75% in my 12th boards , which was kind of showing that , from being a duffer, i’ve become an average student. This was a sort of and infact was an acievement for me and at same time made parents Happy! Time to decide what to do in future, which line to go, MBA’s, Law,CA,CS etc etc. Don’t ask me for what reason, but i Chose CA( not chose, rather decided i should start it), which in due course proved me, that some big decisions taken without giving much of thought may go bad big time. And even after clearing my CPT( phase 1 of CPT, with much of efforts and pushing myself for it) and completing my articleship, i could not perform well and was not able to clear PCC. As a result, went hopeless and broke down with thoughts how can i clear it and what i should do to get a positive result. Gave up on CA( not totally, but after giving my last try and that too for both the groups at same time,for those who does not know there are 2 groups in intermediate or PCC what we say it) and went for preparations of MAT,CAT and other competitive exams for MBA. I performed out of this world( world includes only my performaces :D ) i got some 99.14 percentile in MAT( people may say its not a big deal, it was for me, when considering there’s Maths into it). Hopes inflated ,start preparing for CAT,joined classes, studied for say 3 months or so, but in between some unexpected comes up… Wooah! Cleared PCC, both group at once, yeah! A magic moment it was and was shouting in my flat like fools, it was an achievement! Left behind everything, started preapring for Finals, wooah, happiness never faded for clearing the PCC both groups altogether ( and why not, in my family, was the only one who did that, yes i have more CA’s in my family) , prepared for Finals, gave exams and boom, *flunked* Not a big deal, right,yes… but what happened actually is flunked and repeat, repeat for basically 4 times, till had that one group cleared, and more 5 times till the rest(basically the second group) cleared…!!! Achievement, yes it is an for me, i did cleared them, when i saw everyone giving up on me(except my parents and sister,only one’s i believe in) , made such fun of, adviced of doing things in addition or giving up on it, blamed and criticized for leaving the MBA’s entrance in between, when was getting a good college already,… so basically surroundings was hostile to the decision, but yes! I achieved it, i took all the frustration, pain in me and let the working going on( for not i say, those who quitted, did not worked hard, they ofcourse did, even better than me, but i just decided to not to give up on it and situations were with me, i was lucky enough) So am a CA for now and for my this life and yes i achieved it and am the reason my parents have a pride feeling for me! ( May be there are many CA people around, but for my parents its just me and my Sister❤️) Apart from this, i had achieved a special value in life, which i learned to have in one! It is Patience! Though one could not get enough of it and am still in learning phase, but i have it, maybe little.

My greatest achievement of life is ‘to know myself and be myself’.   In my younger days, I used to be like the people who are considered to be successful. However, soon I realized that there is no fixed formulae of success and everyone succeed in their own way. You can find bosses who perform well by putting their subordinates under tremendous pressure and you can also find bosses, who succeed without even raising their voice.  We admire Mahatma Gandhi who practiced nonviolence and we also admire Bhagat Singh who was a revolutionary.  There is a place for everyone in this world. When we try to become someone, we are under constant state of tension.  Please look the picture of two different springs in the figure below.   These springs are by design of different lengths. If you try to make the first spring to the size of later or vice-versa, both springs would be under the constant tension as they would be craving to come back to their natural size all the time.  We are like these springs. We are comfortable being ourselves.If we live the life of any other person, we can’t be comfortable.   I have tried to discover myself and then redefine success and joy for me.  If I love reading and writing, I do it notwithstanding what other people think about it.   I don’t force myself to imitate anyone or please anyone to win any favours from them. I don’t bother if others consider me successful or happy as far as I am able to be myself and do the things that I like to do.

After my marriage (24-year-old), my father passed way in 6 months due to the failure of his kidney and left my mother, 2 younger brothers, a sister as well as debt. And the same day I had to join my current company as a project engineer but death news broke me out. I hadn't informed my father about joining a new company because I wanted to surprise him. Instead of going to the office the first day I rushed to New Delhi railway station from Gurgaon and caught a train with my wife and arrived home the next morning. My family members were crying and people from the village were thinking that we had no future. Since I was the eldest sibling I hugged my both brothers and encouraged them by hope and I didn't cry in front of them. I studied the situation deeply and calmly and prepared a road map for the next 5 years. After a month I joined my company in Gurgaon and I took care of my family from there. I spent all my money on educating my brothers Sharad (21 yr old) Rajneesh (16 yr old) and kept them motivated. Since my father was a politician so I spend money on the welfare of people too. And I gave responsibility to my brother that he needs to go in politics and continue his studies as well. We worked very hard in order to convince people and after two years my mother won panchayat election and Sharad got a govt and now handling a construction business as well. My youngest brother is studying B.Tech 6 semester. Since we have earned money as well as respect. So people across my village tell our stories to their children. Now 5 years have been passed and I have become financially free from my family responsibilities. It makes very happy for any guardian if all family members do well. This is my greatest achievement. Cheers!!! Edit- Thanks for reading and upvotes

Accomplishment is something that if you accomplish one thing, you make efforts to accomplish another thing, which is tougher than the previous one. Also, what seems to be biggest accomplishment for you, maybe nothing in the eyes of other people. But when it comes to accomplishment, it not always be accolades, medals, appreciation, authority. It can be the tiniest of the thing, as in my case it was. In my school days, I have never been the sort of a person who talks a lot. And because of this reason, I was perceived as an arrogant personality, who is always indulged in her own world and considers no one as per her standards. Well, this wasn't true at all. I was quite because I hate backbiting or rather speaking all what I have heard. My classmates used to maintain a distance because they thought that I won't welcome them in my world. Eventually, with the passage of time, I tried to talk to people, so that I can prove them wrong to whatever extent possible. I tried to make friends but a few of them were only interested in my talks, and most of them were boys. After completing my SSC, I got my school changed and my new school was a girls school. Initially, I found it hard to make friends, but wasn't limiting myself to talking with only a few and avoiding the rest. I used to talk to everyone, be it my friend, or someone whom I didn't knew very well. Those two years passed by and finally it was the Farewell Day. That day, definitely I hold dear, I was being awarded the title of Miss Congeniality. This was an accomplishment for me, as it proved that I wasn't an introvert. The people who thought that I can not be good to others were proved wrong. In addition to it, I became more confident and I also got to know that there was nothing wrong with me. It was only the time and people's perception that defined me earlier, in my old school, with my earlier classmates and now with my new mates.

I’m 14 so mine aren’t that big, but hopefully big things will come soon! My biggest achievement has to be placing for my first time in debate. I have a speech impediment and have never debates before (almost everyone did in middle school) so I spent hours upon hours trying to catch up. I placed and won my first trophy and felt such pride especially because I’m the only freshman in my division who placed the whole year, and I placed multiple times throughout the year (corona cancelled my state tournament:( ).

This is one of the best…. Just prior to my 20th wedding anniversary my company was running a film blogging competition with the prize being a trip to the Cane Film Festival. I’ve watched films all my lie and have always written and so I entered - and was one of the winners… And then I had to tell my wife: Me: So what do you want to do to celebrate our anniversary? It’s a big one. Her: Don’t know. Any ideas? Me: How about a seeing a film? Her: That’s a bit boring. Where? Me: The South of France, at the Cannes Film Festival… Her: WHAT??? And then the fun really started, as the Festival had strict dress codes: black tie for men (so new Dinner suit for me) and long dresses for women. We ended up in a smart dress shop in Oxford full of women buying gowns for end of term balls and/or family weddings. After waiting for a while the Formidable Proprietor approached us, sensing our need for a significant purchase. FP: And what is Madam’s event? A college ball or a family wedding? My wife is a teacher and has a voice that can fill a school hall without difficulty and her reply was priceless. Wife: Neither. We’re off to a gala screening at the Canes Film Festival. (Collapse of various stout parties in the shop). The weekend was amazing: we travelled to our hotel in a limo and the paps go really excited when we arrive d- until we got out… and the film was a let-down: Les Chansons d’Amour - a French musical that (quite rightly) did not appear in any of the shortlists for prizes that year.

15 years or more ago I would have answered with some achievement or having overcome some obstacle. But today, where I am within myself — having reached full self actualization, and having both inner and external authenticity, which is basically about living my life consistent with who I am in the core of my soul, which gives me wisdom and a perspective that was absent prior to all of this — makes the answer gin-clear … By far, the most significant major success in my life is a tie: (1) Having learned how to love unconditionally and actually doing it (loving without conditions nor an agenda), and loving fully, without holding back, and putting myself out there, sacrificing at times my needs or wants or preferences for the benefit of another whom I care for, love and cherish. (2) Living in the moment and being fully present and engaged and activated; and everything that must be in place for this to occur, such as an acute self awareness and self respect, acceptance of what I cannot change, patience, discipline, etc. These two in combination are the utmost fulfilling and freeing “things” I could have, and both have an exponentially significant impact on my daily life, well-being, healthiness, happiness and contentment.

This is one of my best achievement till date though some would deny that it could be one but the sense of satisfaction I got after having achieved that definitely make it among my yet very few achievements.      It is a past achievement though shape my life later. I used  to travel office by bus. My office is very far from my company. My company is one end of the city and my home was in another end. I had to travel whole length of city to get my home. I had to change two buses. Around 3 hours it was taking to reach home. If traffic gets worsened it would take even more. Where I change my second bus is city's main bust stand. When I reach there I would find sea of humans. People are just desperate to get home soon. People are running here and there. Once I get down from my bus I rush to the platform for my second bus with the hope to get a seat. When I reach there already huge crowd swarming around the platform. All are looking at same direction, the direction from where bus would come. Once bus reaches the platform people would grab the door of bus and stick with it until bus stops and door open.Once Bus stops they would shove themselves inhumanly to get a seat into the bus not bothering that by their act one would get hurt. I witness this barbaric act standing away murmuring myself "when people will learn to behave..they don't have any self-respect and they claim they live in civilised society!!, I would never do this, I could not have.." Once this holocaust of humanity over I get into the bus where there is now even no place to step in. I get company of some tired disheartening faces panting with despair for not able to get seat. And  my journey of hell starts. Hanging up in one place for 2 hours makes every moment a nightmare what would hunt me even after I get down from bus when crawling literally to get home what has too long distance of walking. So same was the predicament for many days eventually it became unbearable.    So then this one of the biggest achievements of life came. Having achieved this I was sometimes, which was though unbelievable for me for some days, the first person who could get into the bus and grab the first seat at front row. (obviously window seat that is everyone's favourite and at least desire of that would be understandable to who went through my situation). Though it would look easy from outside yet mustering courage to become barbaric like others or even more than them was difficult for me. It took some days. And soon I learn the art of shoving myself shamelessly not giving heed to people. I just tread upon  my self-respect understanding else would be difficult to survive. When I was the first person grab the sit, my favourite window seat, the sense of satisfaction as if I had achieved something great was inexplicable. And in whole journey my mind my soul was in utter peace, that is too inexplicable.  I understand This would not be considered as an achievement but still after that I learn that this world is not a like five-star hotel and you are an esteemed guest in it where what you want would be served for you in not time but a place where you need to snatch it mercilessly as no one  bothers for you.

I dreamt I was walking down a crowded street when I saw a familiar face in the crowd. He was a friend from highschool whom I hadn’t seen in about three years. When we approached each other we hugged tightly and I felt a profound sense of relief and comfort. Later that day, I met two guys and was hanging out with them. We pulled into a parking lot in front of a store in my neighborhood. One of the guys became threatening and was trying to make me give him money. We got out of the car, then the angry guy snatched my purse and began rummaging through it. When he couldnt find money, he stomped on my purse then shoved my forehead and demanded that I give him money. The guy who had been driving got out of the car to confront his angry friend, acting concerned about his crazy behavior. Suddenly a car sped in front of us and a man got in the crazy guy's face like Chris Brown! The man was my friend, the same one from my dream. I have so-called ‘conjured' another friend and one acquaintance since this incident.

Imagine struggling with speaking difficulties. Now imagine having to teach young people for the rest of your life. It is very, very difficult. But not impossible. I have always struggled to get my viewpoints across and I don't know why. Also, I have struggled with anxiety for as long as I can imagine. Now that I am in a position of making a difference. It has dawned upon me that sometimes you have to try having been given the opportunity. I taught a lesson today to a class of 10 year olds. The concept was very difficult to explain to young children…however I tried. To my surprise the children learned a few things in the lesson. To me that meant everything. I have never felt so satisfied. I want to make differences so that I can live to see those differences positively impact lives forever. It has made me acknowledge that it is the little achievements that can be magnified to fill in the wounds from yesterday.

Have completed my integrated Masters Degree at a great University, learning a lot of practical skills and becoming part of a profession.Working as a Chiropractor I have helped a lot of patients out of pain and even managed to turn around some lives of those who have given up.Completed a Hypnotherapy and CBT course giving me counselling and psychotherapy skills to help people with anxiety, phobias, etc. It is a good feeling being able to help someone in this.Improved my communication skills with people, learning how to improve my relationships with friends and family.Passing my driving test years ago after several attempts and having a lack of confidence in this. I have now driven lots of different cars, both manual and automatic in several countries.Holding a Tarantula and letting it crawl up and down my arm (actually not as bad as you may think and feels very soft and fluffy).Learning to touch-type on a keyboard as a child. Can type out stuff blindfolded if I want to.Improving my physical fitness and going to the gym regularly for my own mental wellbeing.Helping my family in DIY projects like constructing a greenhouse and folly.Have travelled around a fair few countries during my life, including France, Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, Spain, Luxembourg, Singapore, Australia and New Zealand. Some of these alone and relying on myself.Lived in 2 countries and becoming more fluent in my original mother tongue German.

Back in 2013 I took my first medical entrance exam, NEET. I got rank around 28000s. I couldn’t clear that year. Later I joined Miranda House of Delhi University to pursue BSc in zoology. I couldn’t concentrate there. I badly wanted to become a doctor. I decided to take a drop. I prepared well that year but my confidence level was too low. I took the exam in 2014 and my rank was around 20000s. I couldn’t make it. I did not want to waste another year. I joined Sri Venkateswara College of DU for the same course. Again I couldn’t concentrate but I decided to prepare simultaneously. I wrote the exam in 2015 and it was again a failure. I am fit for nothing. I am a loser. My life can never be good. All sorts of negative thoughts were lingering in my mind throughout my college life. It was a dull and a monotonous period. I pretended to be happy but there was something killing me deep inside. However, my interest towards the subject never decreased. By the third year I was slowly moving out of depression and started to focus more on my studies. 2017 I applied for MSc and Integrated Ph.D programs and wrote entrances for that. I secured AIR 14 in IIT JAM Biological Sciences.AIR 120 in IIT JAM Biotechnology.AIR 39 in JNU CEEBAIR 8 in AIIMS M.Biotech entrance examand 2 digit ranks in other small entrances. Are these my achievements? No. My real achievement is overcoming the fear to face a competitive examrising up after three drastic fallscoming out of four years of depressionrevitalizing my confidencetaking control over fear of failureacquiring the maturity to learn from failures rather than lamentingI do not know where I will stand in case I take up major competitive exams like UPSC but I now have the courage to face anything. I have the confidence that I can do it. I will not stagnate if I fail. I know how to maintain a stable mind whether it is a failure or success.

Till now, I believe that I have achieved a lot of things but the one that I will place on the top is :- Leading my platoon during Republic Day Parade, Reserved Police Lines, Ghaziabad.  I am a sector Warden at Civil Defence, Ghaziabad.This year we got an information that this year civil defence will also be participating at the Republic Day Parade which is held at Reserved Police Lines, Ghaziabad. I was specifically advised by our divisional warden ,Rajender Sharma sir to participate in it. So,from 1st January,2020 our training began. Our instructor was Hawaldar Angrej Singh sir of 16th betalion,Punjab Regiment. He taught us how to parade property and out of 100 candidates who applied for he parade ,only 21 were selected on merit of whome I was also a part. Niranjan Yadav sir was selected as our platoon commander not on the basis of merit but just because of the fact that he is a senior and had joined civil defence much earlier than others. Nobody in the group was happy with his command and he was a bit old due to which he couldn't match with the platoon.  This is our group standing with Angrej Singh sir ( in the centre).  Then one day I asked my comrades that what if I'll ask Angrej sir that i want to become the platoon commander.All of than became blvery happy and excited and motivated me to approach him. I went to Angrej sir and said that" sir I want to lead the platoon”. He very politely said that would you be able to do it. And I said yes sir( confidently and determined) .he then said show me by giving command. Then I went on to give the command- Parade ,Bayein se tej chal, Bayein mud, etc. He was impressed by my command and asked me to command the platoon next morning,I did it next morning and he finalized me as platoon commander. Then I commanded my platoon in the parade ,I was able to shake hands with Ret.General Vijay Kumar Singh sir , the M.P. from Ghaziabad who was also the chief guest of the parade. This is the thing that I find the biggest achievement of my life so far ,I hope I would be able to achieve more things,bigger things in my life. Thank you!

After long hours of thinking weather I should stay in Mumbai or go to Chennai I decided to go to Chennai for pursuing my b.tech in aerospace engineering. I didn't do well in four years of my college life. I loved the subject but I didn't able to grasp it, the faculties recruited from Anna University will make you hate every interesting subject. I lost all hope an I stopped paying much attention to studying after 2nd year. I started to believe I have chosen a wrong field. I will be looked down upon by many of my friends. I was supposed to graduate in 2016 after my 4 yrs of btech. But I flunked in one of the subject because of which I graduated one year late in 2017. I started preparing for gate exam in 2017. People will laugh when I will say I m preparing for IIT . I cleared written test got rank 164 , I had got negative marking in only one question. Which helped me secure good rank. In aerospace as seats are less ,I didn't get seat in IIT directly I was called for interview in IIT Madras. The interview went good. I told my mom and dad I will get it. And then the result came I didn't get it. My parents were upset. So I went back to Chennai started preparing for gate 2019 again. And I got a text a text message in August written “ I want to talk to you about MS admission in aerospace engineering in IIT Madras. From HoD aerospace engineering department. “ I was shocked I cross checked the number on truecaller to see if I m not being pranked. I miss that called as my phone was on silent so I called back sir didn't answer I went to IIT directly to his office. And I told him to send me offer letter. Until then I won't believe and I decided not to inform my parents untill its not confirm. As last time they go upset after I gave them hope that I will get. Finally I informed my dad after 10 days that I have got offered from IIT Madras and I m quitting coaching and shifting to IIT Madras .He started crying and he was happy. So yes my biggest achievement was not to get in to IIT. My biggest achievement was to believe in myself when no One did. To know that I know myself better than others. I love this I wanted this. I don't care what people think of me. Thank you

I just couldn’t cope with my learning disabilities, so I left school one morning for good at 14 yrs of age. I didn’t know what to do with my life. As I walked down the road from my school that early morning, I turned a corner and the morning sunshine hit me in the face as an awakening. I realized then, I was fully on my own and I could no longer rely anybody but myself. I knocked on every door of every business asking if they needed help, all with much rejection. I finally, found a used car dealership over 10-miles from the school whom hired me. I was fortunate to get hired by these somewhat wayward playboys of the industry. It wasn’t long before I’m selling cars at 17-years of age and making great money. Buying new corvettes and living and enjoying the moment. My great accomplishment was that I went on to open my own used car dealership at 18-years of age. Unfortunately, I lost the car lot by the time I turned 19-years of age. I was deeply disappointed in myself. I spent the next 5-years of my life beating myself up over the opportunity lost. Although, staying in the industry, I found wonderful supportive people whom guided me and helped me reestablished myself, personally and professionally. (With that support and guidance, I went on to open many more successful dealerships) I learned much from this youthful failure which was all part of the process of growing up and which led to my achievements. Perseverance and resilience pays great dividends.

I am only 22 years old and there is lot more things to achieve but, as question demands I would like to share my biggest achievement in life. The biggest achievement of My life is that I have never let my feelings and hormones to take control over me. I always remain in control. I had never harassed a girl, never tried to molest or take advantage of any girl. Always respected them and never abused or hit a girl. I believe in monogamy, that is why I am currently in a committed relationship for more than 5 years. I see my friends and people around chasing girls and looking for hook up but. believe I never tried or intended to chase a girl or never looked for hook up. The greatest thing for a human is self satisfaction and I am fully satisfied with myself. I love myself because I am a good person and not a pervert. I respect relationships, I respect friendship ( With a girl ) and I know my boundaries. Thank You for requesting answer to this question. Anshuman Jha

*ALWAYS PUSHING MYSELF BEYOND COMFORT ZONE* It is always easy to start pursuing an interest out of one’s volition but difficult to pursue it as a continuing passion with a certain goal post in your mind and heart. Early in my childhood, my parents identified a spark in me for a sense of rhythm and tune. Thus I got exposed to learning hindustani classical vocal training in Guru-Shishya parampara initially at Dehradun and subsequently at Vadodara.  Dehradun is very typical for allergies which is predominant during season change & in winter months. Early in my training as a five year old, I experienced the symptoms of allergic conditions like stuffy nose, congestion which got more complex frequently and was diagnosed as an asthmatic condition. This threatened my self-belief to be able to pursue it in an organized and rigorous way. For a young learner like me a voice that could be free of such medical condition could only enhance the process of learning and appreciating the process. I soon felt it was not possible for me to be able to hit all the high notes while practicing with allergic condition which was not visible on the surface of it and I would end up practicing with a hoarse voice. Singing while hoarse meant you strain your vocal cords and risking setting back your recovery and making voice even worse. Amidst this medical condition and vocal chord changes due to adolescence, I persisted with the advice of my teacher and parents to continue learning and practising singing with self-moderation while opting for self-help, yoga and meditation. My Guru-teacher would start my practice that involved vocalizing on vowel sounds, chanting bija sounds both as a means to release negative energy of the medical condition and as an added benefit for developing voice culture and to bring voice back into balance. I continued my journeying for over 12 years until my 6th year of Prabhakar that clashed with my class 11th. It looked extremely difficult at first to manage school, coaching and riyaaz. However, I continued out of my own passion and joy to complete Prabhakar with distinction. As I retrospect, although initially daunting, daily stepping out of one’s comfort zone was both cumbersome and elating. Overcoming anxieties and having to step out and persist with singing practice proved a career bonus for me with which I got identified in my school, college and in immediate society apart from providing a sense of joy which can be cherished.

Raising these two human beings. I’m not sure what we did to deserve these kiddos, but boy did we get lucky. My daughter has Jacobsen Syndrome[1] so that comes along with its own set of challenges, but she is sweet and funny and happy. She is well behaved and super friendly. She loves people and says Hi to everyone.  This boy is the sweetest, smartest, most empathetic 6 year old I’ve ever met. Being raised with a sister with special needs has helped him to become so thoughtful and caring. He is a leader in his classroom and the other kids always look to him for help. I couldn’t be more proud  So that’s it…my biggest achievement! Footnotes[1] 11q Research & Resource Group

In dreams i saw my past relations with my husband. It proved how being soul mates could help one another in the physical life. During my youth i thought i did not dream. I did not remember i dreamt in the many years i had been sleeping at night. However, there is only one dream i remembered. And i remembered it because repetitively dreamt of it. In the dream, i saw myself curled like a fetus. At the same time, another picture attached to the first part of the dream is also me standing at the center of a circle. The circle is lighted like the light shining on the moon. In the center of the space, i looked farther seeing vast space in grey. It took me some ten or twelve years before i was able to inderstand the meaning of my dream. It was, indeed, symbolical. When i was new in the secret organization where me and my husband are regular members and attendees, i dreamt that our Master Teacher told us all members to stand in one place together. In that spot, we were told to run following a white string placed on the side corner of the road. When our Esoteric Teacher told us to go, we all ran simultaneously. I ran fast like an arrow shot. I felt i was alone running so i looked back. When i looked back i saw our Teacher’s wife far behind with the others running. But she ould not run faster because she was carrying a baby in her left arm, and holding a child’s hand while running. The i continued running, i was alone, but felt someone is running beside me. He was our Teacher. He continued running with me showing where to go if there were blockades or barrier on the way. When i followed the direction he showed me i would run there, looking at the white string on the side. There was a rime when i was already alone running. I only followed the white string wherever it would go. If it goes to an area where i could step on mud and small rocks, i could follow it. If the string went up an adobe fence with uneven placement, i also climbed it up. When i was on the other side of the fence, i saw the highway, white with light. That time i was alone. Then i woke up. To this day i knew the meaning of that dream. Many of my dreams i was able to remember because after dreaming and i woke up, i write them all in my notebook. Perhaps because i do not remember my dreams i was instructed to write them. I had in my side on th ebed a notebook and a flashlight so that i could writemwhile i still remember them. Credits : wonderopolis  Also, there was once a time when i dreamt of fellow members in the secret group where me and husband are regular attendees. In the dream, i saw the girl and the male member singing the same love song together . I do not usually tell my dreams. When they happened, i found it connected with my dream. Later, the two got married ahead of me and my husband. Some of my dreams are literally meaning to describe certain individuals’ characters or personality. When i had the chance to know them, i knew my dreams about them are real.

This is not my biggest achievement in life, but something I’ve achieved recently and pretty proud of. I have always been a sprinter. In sports, work and live I preferred short-term goals to long-run strategy. Today for the first time I swam freestyle for 1500 meters (0.92 miles) without a stop. Probably with a shitty result. But still, this is a huge deal for me. When I just started, I could not swim more than 200 meters in a row. Building a company is the same. You start with short-term goals, like talking to potential customers, launching, validating the idea, making the first 10 sales. Later on, you have to plan for a quote, then a year. At some point, you start setting company direction to what you think the future would look like in 10 or 20 years. I’m far from that at both work and sport. My next short-term goal is to swim 2 km.

Rebuilding my life from scratch and surviving on my own after being kicked out of my parents’ home for being a girl. I grew up in an orthodox Indian family, one which despises the thought of having daughters. My parents always believed that daughters are nothing but a burden and that if they had the opportunity, they would have gotten rid of me. I have a younger brother. From the day he was born, he was cared for like a royalty and I on the other hand was treated like dirt. Long story short, they would pick on me for everything I did. I was provided the bare minimum for survival and my brother lived luxuriously. I grew enduring constant physical and mental abuse for merely existing. I tolerated everything till one fine day I decided that i had enough of this ill treatment and just left when they pushed me out and locked the doors for something petty. Mind you, I was only a graduate fresh out of Uni looking for a job at that time. So, jobless and now homeless me managed to get temporary shelter at a friend’s place and slowly started rebuilding my life. As luck would have it, I landed my first job within a month after that, saved up enough to get my own place and a car to get around. In no time at all, I was completely independent living a decent life. It has been 5 years now. That is by far the greatest achievement in my life.

It's been many..But the best one is being the captain of my team during our annual sports meet at work..It was an ironical achievement too.. Ironical,because I have never been a sportsperson;never ever.. It so happened that all the team members were alloted to different teams-green,white red and black and we only were to allot the captains for the respective teams.. It so happened that people came forward to lead in the front of all other three teams-black,red and white and the only team that was left was green..So the organizers kept asking us who would lead team green from the front and there was no response..This question was repeated for three times and the time was ticking..So since no one came forward i decided to take over the responsibility..the same me,who wasnt a sportsperon,the one who quit sports because of not being sportive decades ago.. So our chief guest,the company MD called me and handed over the team flag and my responsibility.. I participated in the relay and our team became runner ups there … While all others in my team were awesome and gave exemplary performance,I was in the background encouraging them more than anybody… God was also with me..Yes, after a lot events, we were declared the year's champions and I had the best moment when I lifted the cup..This gave me the confidence of a lifetime..

I grew up as the eldest child of a middle class family. Even if we could afford to avail certain small luxurious experiences of life, my family never indulged into them. We never dined out or went on holidays. Somehow, it felt that the people who go to expensive restaurants or five star hotels are a class above, primarily in terms of social status. When I started working, I had a successful career. I earned good money and whether on business or personal expenses, I regularly and sometime only stayed at the most expensive hotels or ate at the best restaurants in the town. Even after ten years of this lifestyle, I somehow felt like an outsider. I always had palpitations when I would check in at an upmarket property. I would feel nervous and even knowing that it is ridiculous to feel that way, I still continue to feel that way. There is a part of me which is still a continuation of my father and his complexes. Few years back, I was out with my younger siblings for a holiday. We were at in upmarket property and I couldn't help but notice how confident and comfortable they were in their surroundings. I must stress that my siblings do not avail these luxuries on a regular basis and almost always it is when I treat them or take them out. They do not feel entitled or behave in that manner. They are not attached to money or a certain lifestyle. But they have the inner confidence. They feel the same in that upmarket hotel as they feel at home or in their college hostel. I realised that the chain has broken. They do not carry the outsider burden that my father or uncle carried and one that I inherited. That is my biggest accomplishment or success in life. I regularly speak to them, encourage them, tell them about the stories of my work and travels and most importantly give them the confidence that they can achieve anything. That confidence shows and is my most satisfying success.

In October 2015 I decided to apply for the job of Team Leader for a residential home for people with learning disabilities. I had previous experience of leading teams within the setting of a hospital for people detained under the Mental Health Act. However, I had no experience of residential services and the role went sour quite quickly. The manager was not easy to work with, the staff team were sly and had an agenda against me and I was having home stress all at the same time. After six months of this I was a defeated man in every sense of the word. I even wanted to quit my ten year career in care work. I requested a de motion to Senior Support Worker at a home for high functioning adults and I was there for 18 months and this went very well. I leant a lot about residential services in this time. Another advert for Team Leader came up again and I went in for it and got the job. Now my role as Team Leader is very successful and I am even having a stint at Acting Manager. One of my most agonizing, most visceral fears was going from a full time employee to unemployed. I understood that many people dream of long vacations and not having to go to work but it was my nightmare. I hardly ever took time off. Without work, what would I do all day? Without the bustle of my job, who would I be? The notion of completely empty days with nothing to fill them petrified me. This terror kept me shackled to a way of life that made me feel both safe and suffocated. Is "safe" worth it if it traps you? One day I decided it was time to turn decades of a very structured life on its head. It was time to follow my own advice and do what I was most afraid of. I quit my job and, well. I don't know how else to put this: I adapted instantly. To my utter shock, I have a natural inclination towards loitering. I loaf. I lounge. I linger. I dawdle. I know. This does not sound particularly dashing. My admission does not exactly portray a hero's journey. Still, I consider this my greatest success and as such challenge the notion that to succeed I have to suffer.

I won’t call this a dream come true moment but it was a moment which felt like a dream. This is about the time when I gave my first motivational lecture to class 11th in a school. Why not discuss some do’s and don’ts about the student life.’ Now coming to the moment when I was giving my first seminar. Everything went well from the start till the end, but something happened in the end which changed my life. After I said ` Thank You `, I got a standing ovation from all the 350 students who were sitting in that auditorium. That was the first moment in my life which actually felt like a dream. That was the moment in which for the first time I felt that ` what I did was actually useful to someone else`. For the first time in my life I told myself that what I just did right now was definitely ` worth it`. From that day I knew what I wanted to do in my life and from that day I actually have a aim to follow and lots of students to motivate. Hope you like it. Stay Awesome, Stay Amazing.

I've always wanted to be a singer. Recently, there was a school concert (considering the fact that I am still in school) and I was asked to sing. When I couldn't decide, a friend of mine offered to play under me and sing with me (unfortunately she didn't sing but I wish she did) and we practised. It was so new to me and I've honestly never felt happier. The day of the concert, it turned out I was singing off-key, which is a problem I have, but I pushed through with singing All of Me. I know I still had to improve because I was singing off-key during the performance but even then, many people and friends had told me it was amazing. Turns out that no one had noticed I was singing off-key slightly but I still think I can improve. I'm proud because on the day, the idea became so much more daunting than it originally was to me. I was at the parlour, there was a middle aged women sitting beside me (say Miss X) , getting her brows done. After a while she asked the woman working there about various facials and the woman kept telling her about how effective they were. She then she looked at a dark brown patch on her forearm which looked like an infection of sorts and asked the woman if anything could be done. “No", said the lady earning a sad smile from Miss X. I sat there trying to form a sentence in my head where I could tell her she didn't have to worry about her scars. By the time I managed to gather my grit she began to leave so I just said, “you're very beautiful, Ma'am”. She was surprised and then she smiled and said, “Thank you. So are you, my dear” That brought a big smile on my face and I continued, “ And Ma'am you don't have to worry about your scars, you're absolutely beautiful with them too” She gave a bright smile and explained how she had gotten them and would be undergoing treatment soon. I wished her luck as she left and I said a goodbye and she replied with a, “good bye, beta”. In that one moment I was super proud of myself So this is my greatest achievement so far.

Along with that, I have long list things including those you mentioned but I am telling you the most valuable things in life. Unless you achieved what's most valuable.. rest everything isn't enough." You don't have to always identify yourself with your job or designation or with the money you have made or the things you have acquired. They are definitely an integral part of life and sooner or later you will have them all. However, if you are not achieving the most valuable things in life which are always intangible then none of the things that you achieved is going to give you fulfilling life. Thank You for reading. Read more at awesomeaj.com

A few years ago I would have answered that my biggest achievement was my academic qualifications and my career. However, today I would say that my biggest achievement has been to unlearn all that I was ‘fed’ and all the ‘myths’ and fears and worries that we were fed in school as a child. I was in a nun’s school which was quite strict. Heaven and hell and punishment played a big role in our education. I grew up with fears, inhibitions and low self-esteem. I had to rebuild myself, bit by bit, and I suffered greatly. I had become my own psychologist. Today I feel at peace. I have made peace with my past. I do not judge myself anymore. I am not harsh with myself anymore, and most importantly I love people and life. Life is beautiful if we decide that we want to see its beauty not its torments. This, I would say, is my biggest achievement.

I wish I had a great happy achievement to share. I guess in the end it is. I was a heroin addict for 15 years. It consumed me. I worked to afford my habit as a stripper and did my drugs to be able to do my job. Heroin was my life. I was so physically and mentally addicted to it that even the thought of quitting was terrifying. Yet I wanted so badly to be free of my slavery to that drug. I tried a few times unsuccessfully to quit throughout the years and it only left me more certain that I was forever stuck. Eventually my live in boyfriend and partner in crime was arrested and put in jail. I was alone, scared and lonely, with a major addiction to feed. After going on, for some time, I decided to try quitting again. This time I called my mother for support. This time I didn’t have the outside influence of my boyfriend to draw me back into using. This time my body was tired of needing a substance in order to function. With a lot of support and some medication and counseling I was able to kick my heroin addiction. I still see my counselor every two weeks and I’m addressing mental illnesses left over from the years of drug use, like depression, PTSD, and anxiety among other issues, but I’m free. I’ve been clean for over 10 years now and I still find it hard to believe that I actually made it through that battle! So while I wish I had a story of winning the Olympics or making the Menza organization, I am very proud of this achievement and it is certainly the biggest one I’ve made in my life.

I was born in a govt. hospital, because my parents couldn't afford a private hospital. the condition of the hospital in those days were pathetic(believe me it's way better these days). When I turned 3 I was admitted to an English medium private school since my parents wanted to give the best of the education to their child, but to pay the fee they had to stop even the basic necessities as basic as milk. So next year they got me admitted to govt. school where I studied till 12th. Fast forward to 2020 here's a pic of me traveling business class bought my hard-earned money.  Although it happened only once, but the moment I booked this ticket all of my family's past flashed in my mind. All the struggle we did to save every penny we could, thinking twice even before spending a small amount. I silently cried while sitting alone and feeling of pride came from within, who knew a 5-year-old boy didn't speak a word standing in a shopping mall looking at his favorite toy because he knew his father will buy that for him and might have to sleep hungry next day will fly business class one day. It may be a very small thing for a lot of people these days, but for me it is huge. So my biggest achievement of life to help my family to gain basic financial stability in life. Edit 1: Thanks for the response, I was not expecting this to have 24k+ views and 350 upvotes.

I haven’t done exceptionally big achievements till now in my life,as an ordinary indian engineering graduate..struggling for a proper job… But this the one which is close to my heart.For me it was an achievement and it will remain forever.Whenever I think of that moment..getting goosebumps.. Once i completed my degree,i got a job(not what i expected,but i had to pursue that job).It was teaching school children basic electronics in the name of robotics.. I was alloted to a school far away from my native..in kerala Tamilnadu border..where most of the students spoke malayalam which i was totally unaware of.I was nervous all time since i hadn’t underwent any sort of training like how to handle students and all..I myself was a fresher who had just stepped out of the classrooms..i had to handle so many children with theory as well as practical classes. It was very difficult for me to handle children starting from class 3 to 9th.But I tried my best to be a better guide to them.More than a teacher,I tried to be friendly and feedback accepting type which i wished from my teachers during my schooling. Then came that day,a month before teacher’s day,all the teachers were presented with a saree in the school assembly at the front stage.For every other teachers, when their names were announced,their respective class children made cheers with claps..But since I was just 2 months to that school,never expected that happened next. When my name was announced,I came to the stage to receive the present from the principal,The loud cheers broke the silence that prevailed the last minute…I was astonished..wondered some other chief guest was arriving suddenly onto the stage. To my shock,I turned back and found no one. I was literally frozen and was physically shivering.I was knocked down with that gesture.The next few minutes,the claps sound didn’t faint.That’s when I realised the love from the children towards me. When I went behind the stage after receiving the saree,the other teachers reacted with a smile.One of them,whispered “Did you hear that?”. I was on cloud nine. That day onwards i became more responsible towards the children.I learnt that every single actions from their favourite teacher they keenly noted and kept following.I was careful with things I did before them. Even 2 or 3 years have passed,after i left that job..Still this moment stirs my heart with pleasure.That was an achievement that i never expected as of to me. Thanks for reading..sorry for that looong answer ;D Au revoir…

I was working as a social worker for the Institute of Disability Studies at the University of Southern Mississippi. I assisted Vietnam Veterans who were exposed to agent orange and as a result of their exposure…had children who were physically or mentally handicapped as a result of their father’s exposure. One night my wife asked me to drive her about 11 miles from our home to a meeting being held at a small cafe in town. A group of people were trying to raise money to open up a shelter home for children who had been abused or neglected and taken into State custody. She hated driving at night on the narrow two lane road. I sat in the corner and listened to the people talk about how hard it was to raise the funds needed. Something made me speak up and ask…”Why don’t someone look into government and private grants to help?” The chair looked at me…asked my name…and said. “Mr Latham, we would be pleased to have you do so. I am sure you wouldn’t mind doing that to help children who have been abused in mind and body and spirit.” How could I say “no” to that? Over the next few weeks, I researched and looked for grants via the University’s library….and four about six that I thought might be good to try for. I took the info to the Chair of the organization…and thought that was the end. It wasn’t. She looked me in the eye and said, “None of us have ever written a grant before. Could you write the applications for us?” I stuttered…”I guess so.” and off I went. Two weeks later I handed them in to her to clean up and submit….and walked away. Two months later…the chair and two members of the board walked into my office with a bottle of champagne. The very first grant I had penned, for $158,000, had been approved. It was enough to get started and run for one year. Then, they asked if I would become the Director of the non profit…it required someone with a degree and a social work license. I ended up accepting the position and Hope Haven …now Hope Haven Child Advocacy Center, Waveland Ms. has been opened for 25 years and has served thousands of children and families in need. It was…and is…the best thing I have ever done. I retired in 2015 and I look back and…am so glad my wife didn’t like to drive at night.

From then he was working hard to keep the family running and he is the bread winner of the family since then. Recently, we successfully finished our Sister’s marriage and I shared a huge financial burden of my dad and I was on my toes till the marriage was over. What’s so great in this? You may ask? As you all know marriages in India are the moments of Pride and let’s not be judgemental here and every other relatives of ours praised for conducting such a great marriage function and my Father proudly told everyone that Without my Son I wouldn’t have been done this. This is the great accomplishment according to me. Cheers.. :)

I was in charge of a huge event in New York City, which included a luncheon for 500 international journalists.  At the end of the lunch, buses were waiting on 50th Street at the base of 30 Rock Center to take them on tours of the city. Rudy Giuliani's 1st wife, Donna Hanover was a keynote since she was a tv personality and after the lunch I was escorting her and a few camera crews to the rooftop to shoot an interview.  As I got on the elevator with Donna (and hundreds of journalists headed down), a panicked staffer rushed up and whispered "there aren't any buses downstairs!"  Seemingly cool and collected, I brought the folks up to the roof, got them situated and excused myself.  While I liquified inside, I de-elevated 70 floors to the street where, voila!  15 buses filled with journalists were idling on the street awaiting my command.  Like Natalie Wood in Rebel Without a Cause, I stood in the middle of 50th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues, raised me arms above my head and plunged them down... and the buses pulled out and thundered past into the 5 boroughs.  From career nadir to triumph in 70 floors!

Now we all get to brag. I can't resist. Too Easy, a novel published by Simon & Schuster, was hailed by Kinky Friedman as "the unwed mother of all page turners”; it was translated into French, German, and Dutch….Here's my most unusual achievement: Theoryland, an 8-page poem that is smart, tells a story, and is fun to read. But the literary world is vast so there are many, many thousands who have done exceptional things. Completely unexpectedly, if I try to think of something unique, I have to mention my work in education. After 10+ years of writing lots of articles, I reached the position of maintaining that there are no good ideas left in the public schools. I explain why our Education Establishment got rid of the traditional, superior ideas. I explain the flaws in the bogus new stuff. Apparently, the brains at Harvard’s Graduate School of Education cannot explain the flaws, otherwise why would they endorse so many destructive ideas? Why would they use sight-words instead of phonics? Why would they push Reform Math instead of traditional arithmetic? Why would they use Constructivism instead Direct Instruction? I have to be careful not to be too cute here. I assume they know exactly the same things that I know but they PRETEND not to. Okay, that would seem to leave me as the solitary expert. That's an achievement however I got there. CODA: I have long said that the biggest problem in American education is low literacy. I've also said that it's the easiest problem to fix. Many readers have trouble with this aggressive position. Maybe the tide is turning. October last year, the New York Times ran a long piece saying we had a big problem because we were using the wrong methods. Thank you, New York Times. It took 60 years but you finally got there.

I don’t know if you can called it an achievement, but I realized the Truth. This is something that set me free from searching and that I will always be forever grateful for. I “achieved” something that I would never lose again, or anyone could take away from me. Something that would never change but was constant and real. I was raised Catholic and always had this hunger inside of me to know God. When the church could not answer my questions, I turned away from the church and embarked on my own journey. I searched for about 18 years. I was abscessed with the idea that there was a Truth that unraveled all the questions mankind could ever have in regards to who we are and why are we here. I searched through many books…not finding. I did not know what the Truth was…but I knew what it was not…so I kept seeking. I had many mystical experiences growing up, but when in 2000 my brother died.. I went into meditation for the first time. I always feared meditating up to that point, since I was able to communicate with those that passed over, but I missed my brother so much that I was willing to overcome my fear and try to connect with him. Not only did I connect with him, but I connected with God. I was guided to meditate every evening and I learned of spiritual things, first only during meditation and then also during everyday activities. Instead of meditating I would spend most of my time in contemplation and communication with God directly until one evening I went to bed with a feeling of a question …but no question formulated in my mind. The next morning I woke up in complete bliss and I realized that I was this bliss.

My dream came true moment was today. All my life I've wanted a dog. I asked, but that didn't work, so I hinted and prayed and did everything imaginable. If you were to ask me what my dream or biggest wish was, my first reply would be to get a dog. Finally it happened. I turned to see my Aunt holding a precious dog swandled in blankets. I teared up and almost tackled my mom in a hug. It really was a dream come true. All the Christmas lists, prayers, and hints have finally payed off. All the times showing her how responsible I am, or how dedicated I could be have finally payed off, and I don't remember a time where I was happier. Experiencing your biggest dream coming true is usdescribable. You feel like it's a dream, surreal, and magical. You never want the moment to end in fear that it'll never come back. I'm so lucky to have experience my dream coming true, and I hope every person in the world could feel the joy I feel right now at least once in their life.

My kids are the best thing I have accomplished in this life. I love all three of them for the amazing people that they are and the amazing people they are yet to become. They will have opportunities that I never even dreamed of and they will do amazing things. Getting the chance to be their Dad has been the highlight of my life. Nothing fills me with more joy than spending time with them doing what they enjoy doing and see them smile. If you don’t have kids, you will never understand this. Before I had kids, I was a selfish, self-absorbed asshole. Now people might say, I am a selfish, self-absorbed asshole with kids. hahaha. But people who knew me before kids and after kids will remark how much more laid back I am and how much I came to realize that there is no such thing as “perfect”, not in tasks, or people or anything and giving up that idea of “perfection” as an expectation is something that only happens once you have kids. I am grateful for how rich my kids have made my life and I love all three of you. They follow me on Quora so there is a good chance they will see this. Thanks, guys, for being the awesome people you are.

My current work on articulating a modern viewpoint which advances the harmony of true religion and true science will be, hopefully, my greatest achievement.  In another realm, building a lasting family life and raising my daughter (ongoing) also ranks up there, in terms of difficulty, reward and potential contribution to the future.  This is especially significant given the destructiveness I had to overcome in my own personal history to get to the point that I could rebuild my life along spiritual and pragmatic lines.  Third, I've taught and otherwise accompanied many people in the learning process via both technical and religious educational efforts.  Last, and least, I have contributed something to the advancement of technology. I'm pretty sure my VMS HiPPI drivers are still actively in use at CERN, for instance, and I've contributed to a lot of other products and concepts over the years.

“Every achievement looked BIG until I achieved it.” In my journey of life, definition of achievement changes from one phase to other. Whenever I achieve something and think about it after some months or years, I literally feel, it’s just nothing, even though, I am desperate and struggled a lot in the journey of achieving it. In India, for Engineering undergraduates, who come from a middle class family background, getting placed in a product based company is just a dream even today. So, let me tell my 22 years life story: Year 1997: After struggling for 9 months inside my mothers womb, I came out into this beautiful world and it took some time for doctors to make me to cry. Achieved: LIFE. Years 1999 - 2002: My health got deteriorated frequently. Got infected by different kinds of diseases like Cholera, Typhoid, Diarrhea and finally effected by severe Chicken Pox.Even Some of our relatives thought, I may die and believed that giving treatment is waste of money. But neither my mom nor my dad lost hope and that little body healed back quickly, miraculously.Achieved: HEALTH. Years 2003 - 2005: The person whom I love the most, my mother, got effected with sudden and a severe nerve damage in brain. It took her a year and half to completely heal and gain back health.Middle class family, dad need to work, I am around 8 years, my sister is still a baby. Thinking about my incapability to help dad and seeing the pain my mother went through, I don’t know how many times I cried hiding myself.I am not sure whether it can be called depression or not (I was a kid, don’t even understand what it is). But, thank god, I came out of it quickly.Achieved: RELIEF. Years 2006 - 2012: Primary School life: Luckily got admission into Kendriya Vidyalaya ( A school, funded by Central Government of India), children whose parents serve for nation study in this school. Hence, studying in K.V is really a privilege.Studying here, develops an individual both personally and emotionally. Also, since we grow between students from different cultures, our maturity levels increase.Here, comes the problem, for a student who doesn’t know Hindi, it’s little tough to mingle with, but one can manage by speaking English. Local language is spoken very less and it took me 3–4 years to properly understand and speak Hindi. But, never once I failed to get good marks.Here, we doesn’t get spoonfeeded with important questions. One need to prepare independently for exams. Learnt to be independent and consistent and passed with 9.4 CGPA (Now, it doesn’t even matter but at that time, achieving a 9 or 10 pointer is great)Achieved: CONSISTENCY. Years 2012 - 2018 I didn’t enjoy my high school life because I forget to live life like a human. I fell into rat race to get into IITs, NITs and other prestigious colleges. The lifestyle is same as a robot.Experienced my first failure in my life as I failed to get admission to prestigious colleges of the country and ended in a local college.I took my Engineering challenging, even ended up with a backlog in 1st year, never felt lost, rolled up my sleeves, cleared it next year, understood algorithms, strengthen my coding skills, passed with an 8 pointer, to be precise 8.5 GPA.Mu Sigma: REJECTED, Amazon: REJECTED, Infosys: REJECTED..…. similarly got rejected by around 21 companies, mocked by classmates, teachers and relatives, but never lost hope, became more determined and finally got placed in Worlds No.1 CRM Company.Achieved: My DREAM. (5 years back) Currently: In process of buying a house for my parents!!There are many other things which I have achieved in my life, which made me as well as my parents happy. Once, I look back at the things I achieved, they all look very small when compared to my next goal and this cycle continues. Let me repeat my statement again: “Every achievement looked BIG until I achieved it.” I wish to write more, but will stop it here!! Khudhafeez 👋

Inventing variable speed video. Which I controlled by the speed of exercise equipment. I bike raced for a long time and imagined being able to “pre-ride” courses on my indoor trainer in the winter. So when he opportunity came, a combination of me breaking my leg while working on the Alta ski patrol at the same time that Trip Hawkins’ 3DO player made it possible to play almost full screen video from a CD, I did it. I raised $25000 from friends and family, went out to the 3DO developers training, and somehow was guided by employees there to the man who wrote the code to play video on the 3DO. When I explained to him what I was trying to do he showed me exactly where in the source code the timing mechanism was. By July I had it working. But that was only the beginning of the story. One of the ends is here, a big company who licensed it for years and suddenly decided to stop paying me but keep selling it: “The course view speeds up or slows down with the speed of the treadmill.” Discover SE3 Interactive Courses | Life Fitness
