Living to my current “ripe” old age is an “achievement” all to itself I think. All in all perhaps the “biggest” achievement anyone could attain is longevity. Time is the medium where everything else exists, including time to “achieve” stuff in the first place. Even time “wasted” is nice to have had. Disclaimer and Exceptions Certainly such time spent in misery, pain or something as dire has the potential to be worse than a shorter time, but for me specifically, fate had placed me well. Also, fortunately I was never in a situation wherein I was called to task but certainly one that sacrifices their life for others and such are way up on the scale or more substantial than me in the “achievement” catagory. Anyway That would be my thought in this technology driven world of carcenigenes, cars, guns, dense population, 110,000 laws/ regulations enforced by empowered lethally armed (“imperfect as we all are”) people, homelessness (no more forests or “neutral areas” to exist- everything is owned by somebody), storms, lightning, electrical hazards, controlled substances, serial/ mass murderers, dangerous jobs and incarceration.

I feel very sorry for my inability to answer your question directly due to the following reason : In my opinion, the state of achievement is the perceived end result of our Expectations. If we learn to live without expectations of our actions, we would never land into the state of regret or proudness. The thought of achievement is born out of the nature of result which in turn evolves from our expectations. In other words, if there is no expectation then obviously there is no thought about achievement. Why I am living without any expectations? We are capable only to initiate an action. The initiated action brings the result only after passing several constraints of external parameters such as environmental, social , hierarchical, incidental etc. Since the expected result is directly proportional to our initiation (I), our follow-up or hard-work (FH), the external parameters (E) (that are absolutely beyond our control), there are lot of possibilities for the Actual result to match the Expected result. Result (R) = I x FH x E (where E is not absolutely in our control) Imagine a status, where our initiative is fantastic (so I gets 1) and our follow-up or hard-work is splendid (so FH is also 1) and unfortunately if one of the aforesaid external parameters hasn’t supported our action, then E becomes 0. This way, the value of Result would be 0 (zero). So we end up getting ‘0’ actual result against the expected result of ‘1’. When Expected result doesn’t match the Actual result, we will get into the state of Regret and I don’t want to fall into this state very often. So I don’t know what I have achieved. But I know what I performed.

What would I consider to my greatest achievement in life? Hands down…my children. I think all parents wish for their children to achieve more, be more than they are - and that was my wish. I grew up with low self-esteem and lofty goals , but low achievement. When my three daughters were born I honestly thought they were a clean slate where I influenced their final picture. Although I worked outside of the home, I devoted myself to my children and their success. Now, to me, success does not necessarily mean more education and more money, but rather they find happiness and satisfaction with their lives. Proudly I am the mother of a graphic designer,turned teacher. Another daughter is a doctor who has won the praise and acclaim of her peers in the medical community, the third moved to a foreign country to marry and is now a teacher. All are married, happy and, by all accounts, successful. They call me regularly, not out of obligation, but because we love “catching up”. Lucky me!

I am 20 years old. And till now according to Me the achievement which I am going to share with you is the biggest achievement. So here I begins........ The time when I was in class 10th, there held an inter school declamation contest in the school at the next city. And the principal of our school wants her students to participate in it. That's why 9th and 10th class was informed about the competition and were given the topics to prepare. The two students were going to be selected for the competition out of which my classmate named X was already selected as she was participating since 4 years and brought prizes for the school. So now it was the time for the selection of second one. There were approximately 20 students in line for the selection. The principal mam and our English teacher who was given the duty to prepare us filtered the three(including Me )out of 20. We were given two topics - 1.women empowerment and 2. Money a modern addiction. The first topic was given to X who was already selected and the second one was given to us three. Three of us practised for three four days and finally the time came of selecting one out of us. We three ( me, y, z) delivered the speech in front of our principal mam, vice principal mam and our English teacher. Out of us Z was rejected and then again it was tough to select out of me and y. And unfortunately everyone there liked y. She was very well than me but ohhhh my Fortune , even though she was good but I was selected due to my cuteness. ( not lying actually I was selected only and only due to my cuteness ) Principal mam said that I was so cute that judges would be automatically impressed . And at the end I was selected. Huhhh finally covered the selection. Now there was the time of practice. X and me we both practice daily and deliver in front of our sir. He was very happy to listen X but not me and the reason he pointed out was my same tone ( that is, sorrow tone) in whole speech. Everytime when I gave the speech he got disappointed. I was also so worried because I wanted that I should be selected because of my ability. The class 9th and 10th everyone were knowing about the reason of my selection and all of them were blaming the teachers and principal for being partial in my case. One afternoon X and I were practicing our speech under supervision of our sir in the playground as usual. He listened us both but again got disappointed from me and he turned angry. He asked me to speak a line from the speech of X and the line was - women are raped, kicked, killed….. which X speaks rapidly in anger tone. I copied her and spoke up the same but Sir pointed me out that I had copied her if that would be the line of my speech I would speak slowly showing the sorrow. And by saying this he left us ,we went home. It takes one hour to reach home and that one hour I was just thinking about that line and sir's wording and there I realized that what do sir mean by tone and since so many days I was taking tone as pitch and was improving daily in my pitch. I reached home locked my room and cried bitterly for one hour. And then I promised myself to improve. I stood up in front of the mirror and practiced so hard till I reached school next morning. Once again now it was time to deliver in front of principal mam and sir. Sir called us both , went to the office. First it was the turn of X and next me. I started my speech....complete silence in the office, everyone were listening me silently. I ended my speech and what I see is that principal mam giving standing ovation and clapping for me..... ohhhhhhh my god then I got relief. They praised me a lot. They were shocked of my transformation. And I was so happy. Then, sir got an idea. He called Yand Z again and kept a competition between us three and the judges appointed for this task were some (approx 7-8)of the brilliant students of class 10th. Everyone had to give us marks out of 40. And the winner would be the student having highest total. And offcourse the winner was me now. Sir played this game only to get rid of the blame of partiality. Finally the tension was over and now X and me were focussed for the inter school competition. The competition was to be held for two days - trial and final . There were 28 schools participating in the trial - two students from each school, in total 56 students out of which 5 schools that is 10 students were to be selected for the final round. So finally after three to four days the trial round had come. X and me went there, along with the sir ,delivered the speech at our turns and were waiting for the result. Huhhh now the result time, tension everywhere, complete silence, fingers crossed. The host announced the position 5th…….. 4th………, 3rd……….2nd ………..and then the first goes to our school means us.... Yeahhhhhhhhhhh sooooo happy all three of us. We both got the participation prize and the certificate.  After four days was the final round.... Once again we went there along with sir, delivered the speech at our turns and waiting for the result. Now the game was among 10 students out of which 5 individual prizes were to be given. And till now it was believed by everyone (including me) that X is better than me and she will definitely get the prize. Results going to be announced, complete silence, fingers crossed,... The host announced the position 5th and that goes to X...... Ohhhhhhhhh noone was happy from us. Complete sadness on our face.  Because we were of the thought that if X stood 5th then I would definitely not get any of the position . Sir, me and X all three losed the hope. X went up the stage for the trophy. Thereby, host announces position 4th, 3rd, 2nd and then the first that belongs to meeeeeeeeeeeeee......... sir and me jumped with joy and said yesssssss we have done it.... And then I went up the stage for the trophy, called our honourable sir up , had a photograph and happily went back homes. Next day, the both positions were announced in the morning assembly , got a lot of congratulations from everyone we met and achieved all the happiness...... Sooooooooo this was my biggest ever achievement.

Coming into relationship with my emotional body. Learning to feel my feelings, and developing a curiosity about their source and meaning. And all the personal growth that has derived from that. When I began healing my deeply-hidden emotional wounding, my spiritual self naturally emerged. And so I've developed a first-person relationship with the divine. My intuition, insight and creativity have opened up and become more acute. Having learned this with the help and mentoring of other men of the ManKind Project, it's now part of my life's purpose to facilitate other men in their own emotional development as well. I went through many years without this access… as a man who left a lot of collateral damage behind me. Those days seem to be over now. I have learned to love and be loved like never before. Highly recommended for all men. Namaste!

Courage to let go I think my greatest achievement is the, courage to let go things those are no more and may not help me to lead a iconic life Right from our childhood we have been learning a lot about achievements, how and why achievements are important but what happens when you have achieved great heights in your professional life but you don't have time for your family and kids. You want to see your younger brother, and want to coach him life lessons, want to spend time with your mum but your work commitments are not allowing you to do that. You have two offers in hand one is giving you a significant amount to live a luxurious life but almost no time for family and the other one is giving you less pay but possibly more time with family. I am choosing the second option Coming from a poor financial background to this stage of my life where I am getting paid real good but again want to go a little down because family is important, is a difficult decision for me. I feel I have learned to let go

Accomplishments, aren't stagnant. We keep on accomplishing one after another things in life. I grew up in a very small town of our country, north lakhimpur, Assam. My schooling, I did here. I studied in kendriya vidyalaya, yes it is dignified here. My class 10th results were awesome. Scored a 10 cgpa. It was a big deal! My parents were so proud of me. Not all my friends were able to score (not boasting), but I did. I guess my first accomplishment. My second accomplishment was when I received a 5000 rupees cheque for my class 10th result. (kv policy). Yes, I know it was just for class 10th which I already achieved, but I believe this was the first salary I would say, which I earned with my knowledge. 12th was average!!!! Then, I wanted to do engineering (conventional, I know) but no one was there to show me a way. My parents, are advocates, they couldn't help me. But they did whatever they were able to do. Finally I cracked the west Bengal entrance examination. And now I am doing engineering. Third accomplishment. Owning my own laptop is my fourth accomplishment. Able to travel alone and making mom and dad’s strain less is my fifth achievement. The list goes on. As the saying goes “boond boond se dariya Banta hain” (drop drop river becomes). Waiting for that one big river, which these drops of my little accomplishments will build and that day will sail the boat with my beloved family, on that river to experience the ultimate Accomplishment. These little things don't sound big, but believe me they feel big. Thank you. P. S. Let me know if I wrote the English proverb wrong. Because I don't remember it properly.

I work at an NGO as a smartphone assistant to senior citizens. There was an old grandpa who would always walk in with his cane, smiling. His children had bought him a smartphone and he had no idea how it worked. He was from another time, a time of more peace and less screens. We walked through the basics of the phone. It was heart-warming how he giggled like a young child everytime he touched the screen and it responded. For him, this was magic. We struggled, but he was smart. He had a notebook in which he would jot down notes and he even studied before each session. A few weeks later he video-called his son using Skype and his eyes watered up. So did his son's. That moment-- was eternal. It is by far, my greatest success. He was and is one of my best students. This achievement was ALL his but he's sweet enough to give me credit for it. I'm 22 and he's around 4 times older. We connected over a magical screen that moves when you touch it.

Being me. You might see this as something stupid, but actually it's not. It takes a lot of guts to be true to yourself when everyone around you is giving you reasons to doubt your choices. As a person, I'm headstrong, full of flaws and strength, critical of society, a believer of God, and I get attached easily. Despite people telling me that I should live like a robot, running the rat race, I chose to be who I'm, a human. Humans can commit mistakes, they can cry, they can feels emotions, have a scope of improvement and follow God or His words, unlike robots. Therefore, I cry when I've to, yell when I've to (though I'm working on it), argue when one presents me an insanely illogical notion, help when I have too, pray as I desire (institutional religion should be shunned) and follow the voice of my skull, or atleast try to follow it as much as I can.

Getting Married and breaking the ancient generational jinx of runaway Fathers. I am married with 2 beautiful children and I cannot imagine life without my family. I would have felt like a total failure If I were a billionaire without fulfilling my mission of being a different man than my father was. Nothing really fancy! I will define achievement is something i can take pride of. During my summer vacations i was part of a really amazing set of people at National Innovation Foundation, Being a computer science student i took up a project which consisted of building an Android application for the local farmers so they can communicate with scientists regarding pest and other agricultural issues. I understand this is no fancy breathtaking application but i was really happy with the fact some farmers were using the application on daily basis. The moment my team went to demonstrate the application to the farmers. The farmers were so happy to see someone working on something to make their life easier. They insisted us to come inside have a drink to relieve us from the summer heat. I haven't lived long enough for greater accomplishments, but here is one I am very proud of.   aside from taking all the trash out I also unblocked the flow of water which was held up by a lot of bamboo. I cut that giant tree in half as well to further let the water flow. It took a very very long time but now the water flows a lot cleaner, the fish are able to move up and down stream easily again and there are less chances of beaver damming it back up.  The next picture was a project I actually just completed yesterday. The entire tree was taken out through a very hard process. Me my one friend and my father all went down, as my father is the head of public works for the town we live in which this lake and stream is located. The hardest part was getting the big parts of the tree cut. We cut it into many sections and at one part me and my friend had to life one of the entire branches up, which was at least 300 pounds probably more, and hold it while my father cut it apart. Then was put it all on the bank and ripped out the tinier sticks and branches stuck underwater. This was an even harder task because of the size of the tree that we needed to take out. I didn't take an after picture yet, which I'm doing later today, because my hands were soaking wet and I didn't want to ruin my phone. But as you can see from this picture above the downed tree collects piles of trash which then pollute the water in the area greatly, leaving a green slime. The reason I do this is because it's what I love to do. I hope to have something like this become my career as I'm currently studying to become an environmental scientist/technician  Here was the final result. Took this picture yesterday

Let's begin with a stereotype answer to this kinds of questions- academically I am a CA, first attempt through out. I guess that's it, that's where the human capacity to measure achievements ends. Or I can as well brag about how much I earn working in a MNC. FULL STOP. MY USELESS ACHIEVEMENTS ENDS. NOW COMING TO THE MAIN STORY So it was 14th August, around 1 am and I was on my bed, thinking of ways I can anyway be of help to our army men. I thought of many things and then I read somewhere about 'BharatKeVeer' portal by Government of India where you can directly contribute to a martyr's account or you can donate to a common corpus. So I instantly made some donations through that portal. Then I came up with an idea, why not tell everyone in my company that such a portal exists and urge the employees to contribute as well. My company has around 9.5k employees and if only 3k of them contribute 500 RS each, the contribution would be 15 L. Because deep down we(most of us, barring ungrateful pigs) want to anyhow help our soldiers but we just keep on procrastinating/ forgetting it. Or maybe because sharing a photo of army on certain dates is an easier way of showing gratification than other stuffs. So I wanted to spread the word, but HOW? How can I reach to every employee? I thought of using the ‘Internal Communications' mail mechanism. But using the Internal Communication forum for my own idea required many approvals and other stuff and I had just one day to do all this, ie just 14th because 15th would have been a holiday. It would not have been possible without a master key. Guess what I did? I directly wrote on that night to the CEO/MD of my company, Sandeep Kishore, describing the vision and asking for supreme permission. And then I slept. The next morning I woke up, the CEO had forwarded that message to Chief Marketing Officer, Chief Human Resource Officer, Chief Financial Officer asking them to aid me to fulfil this task. That day, I met all of them and shared a draft to be circulated to the employees. And by 6 pm, the mail was sent to everyone. On that circulation mail, the distributing team made a call themselves to include that I took this initiative. Within minutes of reaching the mail to employees, I started getting mails from the donators that they have contributed and would also tell others in their fraternity to do so. They thanked me for bringing to their notice that portals like that exist. For the first time in my life, I felt I achieved something. That day I came to understand what real achievements look and feel like. And yes, attaching a screenshot of that mail and urging you guys if you could also implement this in your organization and spread the word. I guess its an initiative which needs a little bit of determination from your end for persons who are ready to ready to lay down their lives for you, ANYTIME. I guess that's it. Pardon my grammar, language and other mistakes. Kinda new fellow on Quora. Jai Hind.

Hmm. Biggest Achievement? Well it might be me getting into a prestigious college after flunking my 12th grade in the 1st attempt, which made my parents little proud. probably when I came first in a swimming race or when I weigh lifted dumble of 30 Kgs while still being skinny or maybe when over 14K people watched a meme video I made. or maybe when I had an average likes of 100–150 on every meme I posted but probably my biggest achievement is that I learnt to Ignore or endure criticism & judgments. A lot of my peers and people of my age get easily offended if someone criticizes their work or actions. They react angrily to judgmental statements from others or assumptions. People of my age surely have an inferior complex & poor self esteem. I’ve experienced a lot of mockery, taunting, criticism & prejudices yet 2 years into college & I have successfully learnt to ignore these. I’ve learnt to endure it & focus on work that I was meant to do. I don’t react to it unless it hurts me physically or affects me in studies or family relations. While a lot of people react angrily to a simple statement by others. I don’t respond to those who mock me or try to troll me. Thankfully being a memer I somehow have learnt to have better comebacks. A lot of roast sessions take place in my peer group yet I am the last one to fall out. Just 2.5 years ago I was on the brink of committing suicide because I flunked 12th Grade, some people mocked me or taunted me. 5 Years back I was visibly damaged because a girl who was surely way out of league rejected my proposal. Looking back at these small things made me realise how easily I could have fell down, how easily small things affects us so much. We all should learn from our past experiences. We all should learn to ignore or endure criticism, assumptions, mockery, tauntings & judgments. Even If it’s hate speech, someone commenting about our weight, shape, height, eyesight, marks, salary, relationship or even religion & political associations

There are like thousands things that I have achieved till now from my inseparable bonding with friends, awesome memories and moments since childhood etc etc But today I would like to share one of my achievements which I think was a little special for me and also an unexpected thing. Here goes the achievement  The arrow head is pointing at me. I ranked 5th in whole West Bengal Boards class 10 examination 2011. The Lady is our Honourable Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. She invited us to the Writer's Building of West Bengal. On the felicitation day, I reached the State Secretariat on time and went straight to the conference room through a VIP entrance with my Father and Uncle. Our CM came to the conference hall a few minutes later. She felicitated everyone, she heard patiently what each one of us wanted to say and if we were having any problems. High ranked Bureaucrats of Dept of Education were also their. At the end she gifted us a laptop and copy of hand written manuscript of Gitanjali by Rabindranath Tagore. There were News Channels photographers everywhere. When we came outside the hall there were atlest 100 camera flashes at a time and everything was happening so fast and randomly I was really puzzled.  This achievement is really special for me because I made my parents very proud. The above arrowhead in the picture is my father standing with pride beside the Chief Minister of West Bengal. That was a hell lot of experience and memory for a 15 yr small town boy like me then. Thanks for reading ❤️

Long ago, a boy was born in a small town in India. His father was a doctor and he was also expected to be intelligent like his father. In his early years, his parents noticed that he was slow in learning things compared to other children around. He started walking at the age of 2.5 years, rarely spoke anything because he was very shy and always liked to be where he is i.e. he was not active in anything. His parents thought that he would grasp things slowly in school too and to give him sufficient time to learn things, they admitted him to school at an early age of around 3.5 years. Things went on as expected. He was slow to learn the alphabet and scored badly in the kindergarten. He was just able to pass. He could not make many friends and most of the students from his class considered him as a loser. His performance improved a bit in grade 1 and 2 but not much and things went on in the similar fashion till some time. However, suddenly his life took a big turn. His father got transferred to a city in the mid of the academic year when he was in grade 5 and he had to change the school in the mid of the session. With the average scores the child had got in the previous years, it was very difficult to find a school in which he could get admission. But in a few days he got admitted in one of the new schools of the city.  With the new school, new problems arose. The new school had a rule according to which the students had to talk only in english, with teachers as well as friends. The boy had never talked in english with anyone ever in his life, though he had taken english as a subject in his earlier school. Along with that the boy had half yearly examinations going around in his school and he had an exam on the first day itself. The boy appeared in all the exams on that day as well as those in the coming days without any preparation. After a fortnight when the results were out, he was sure that for the first time in his life he would have failed in all the subjects. But to his and his teacher's surprise, he had scored 64 percent in the exams (which was decent for someone who had not attended any of the classes) and had failed only in the subject whose exam was on his first day in the school. This changed his life completely. The boy who was never appreciated for anything in his life, was honored on the stage by his class teacher in front of his classmates for his performance. While in his earlier school his classmates called him a loser because he did not talk with many people, in his new school he was awarded as the "Most Disciplined Child". People change the way they evaluate your deeds as soon as you become a star. Class toppers started picturing him as their enemy, who was soon going to take their position. All such proceedings boosted the self confidence of the boy and he decided that he will raise the bar. After constant hard work throughout the next 5 months, he was rewarded. He stood 3rd in the annual exams and 5th in the school.  But he realized that he was still not the best scorer and so he did not continue to work hard in future. But his destiny was somewhere else. Another turn in his life. In grade 7, a boy took admission in his school( let he be X) who started to sit in the lectures along side him. X was an overall champion. Good in studies, participated actively in co-curricular activities and fair at sports as well. Everything that a secondary school teacher wanted. The boy enjoyed his friendship with his friend X but there was one thing he could not digest. If he can do well, then why can't I. So, he started again, in a quest to be better than his fellow friend. He started panting in his way, tiring more than usual. But he had to prove something to this world. THAT HE CAN DO IT. All his activities started to be designed in such a manner so that he can get one step forward in achieving his goal and records slowly started reflecting it. From 78 percent, his percentages started rising to 82, 87, 89, 91 and 92. It was finally in grade 10th that he could reach his goal. Yes, he did it. He defeated the topper, the best one around. But in the due course he lost his friendship due to jealousy of Mr. X. But from here he never looked behind. In grade 11th and 12th, he started preparing for IITJEE, one of the toughest exams in India where only 1 out of 50 registered candidates are successful. But he had learned now that looking behind will not do any good. After two years of hardship, which he had started to enjoy thoroughly, he came out with flying colors. He had defeated those 49 students out of 50 who had used to call him a dumb, loser and what not. Optimism and patience can do wonders..... really.    Yes, that's what I learned. P.S.-    This is my life story in short for you.I am still not good at english. Remind me about grammatical mistakes, if any.

I Got My Place In The Guinness Book of world records ! That's my recent and biggest achievement so far. Around 6000 bharathanatyam dancers danced together at a time in Chennai, Tamilnadu - under the theme of rain “BHARATHA MAZHAI” to support agriculture. And we have broken the previous record that had happened in Ireland and have set a new record. You can see the videos in YouTube under the search tag “ BHARATHA MAZHAI”. That was an awesome moment when we created this new history  The costumes are in blue to symbolise water (rain). And some paddy grains are within the pot on our head to symbolise “with the help of rain, all the grains should grow well”  All the dancers who danced, got our places in Guinness book of world recordsAsian book of records andIndia book of recordsI'm so excited and eagerly waiting for my Guinness certificate: )

I’d like to think it might be my volunteer work on a Board for Disabled and Special Needs Consumers. I actually have my name in bronze on one of our buildings. But I think volunteering at my Primary school, might be my legacy. Who knows what child I may have touched and helped. Or as a donor of platelets for babies and cancer victims, maybe I will save the life of someone who will save the world. I used to work the local polls (everyone should do that for at least one election), but that will never lead to a legacy. I have three grandchildren, 2 of which are extremely smart, maybe it will be them. But truth be told, I think a lot of people would be surprised if after their death, they found out their real legacy. I don’t think it’s really known until then.

I was with a large crowd of people by the lake on a calm summer night. Killing time, drinking beer, smoking large quantities of reefer. Not even a breeze. The reefer smoke hung thick in the air around our heads, burning our eyes and clouding our vision. I took a particularly deep hit off a joint, then blowing a smoke ring so thick that you could put your fist through It. It cruised on a line drive over the lake a good 30 feet away. Every last guy there was in awe as it finally dissipated beneath the moonlight. I said that’s nothing as I stood on the shore and blew one ring after another that didn’t break up until they almost reached the other shore. That was easily my proudest moment

So, I couldn't study, or talk with friends or get a gf. So, what I did? I cured my schizophrenia in a record time, I don't have delusions, voices in my mind or hallucinations. It took a lot of time of reasoning, but that investment was good. Also I completely controlled my OCD, was hard as hell, it took every day thinking how could I improve my symptoms. These are my two life achievements, I did more than 99 percent of the people with such illnesses in less than two years. Also when I was a teen I hacked sxe injected which was a program used in games, I was so successful that they had to change the whole thing 9 times with 9 different versions.

Year9- Year 13. I was going from one subject to another and since the highschool came out with a trades Academy. I stuck with hospitality yet only achieved what I learned from that class. Other lessons such as Science, Maths, English and Social Studies I never gave mind to. So in the end of leaving school. I finished my studies, obtaining level 1 literacy and numeracy. To be honest I thought that was what I would achieve. But when I moved from Taumarunui to Auckland and enrolled in a course teaching residentials literacy and numeracy level 2. I earned myself that level of achievement and then got onto a NZMA (New Zealand Management Academy) course doing hospitality level 3! Well, doing just that I went to level 3 literacy and numeracy in which you can obtain if you stuck to the hardwork in school! SPITE OF THAT I was pretty amazed but I wouldn’t say this was enough development in learning to make me want to start university. Not with the accomplishments I got when I left at the age of 18yrs old. I wish I done better tbh!

Once there was a boy who went to a fair,enjoyed it and than sat on one of a swing and had such a terrible experience that in the midst of it he started to scream to stop it,cause it was a nearly death experience for him,so when the swing came to stop that guy was so scared and pissed that he gave upon sitting on any of those things from that day onwards whenever he saw them he just kept a fine distance from them. Fast forward 4 years,now one day this guy went to an amusement park with his friends and when he saw his friends going for a ride in one of those swings,he sat down with them but the past memories came to his mind and he just got off from it saying you guys enjoy I will join u later,next they all went to another ride and same So after 3 rides,this guy decided to sit in one of those so in order to make him feel safe his friends accompied him,now when the swing was about to start,the guy said that he would not make it and please let him go off,but his friends asked him to keep his calm and just have trust,now as the ride moved the heart of the boy started skipping,now when it reached at its top then moved to the most fun part,you know what the actually started enjoying,now all his fear and anxiety was gone, at that moment the only thing he knew was fun and happiness achieved by those rides. Yes that boy was me and that day I finally gave up on my fear of sitting on swings.It was like conquering your biggest fear and that day holding to my decision to stik to that ride was the best decision i took.Now my friend don't have to face the constant rejection from my side,on not sitting on one of those.:) It's was one of my biggest victory.

I stand different from the crowd. At a time when everyone is running in a rat race to earn a lot of money, I have reached a stage in my life where the lust for the money is almost nil. I see a lot of people around me dying to earn money, fame and power. They work hard and forget to have a breath in peace. They don't enjoy the present and worry about the future, which they may never be able to live. Whereas I smile, happily, standing in the middle of the farm, under the hot sun, without any reason. Being able to stay happy, in almost every situation, is the biggest achievement, so far.

My children are the biggest successes in my life - and I can't even take full credit, even though I was mostly a single mother. During the worst part of my life and their childhood I was married to a crazy guy - he was on drugs, stimulants, and just had some very strange ideas about life in general. Both I and my three kids suffered because of it, and I was trying so hard to get out of the marriage that I wasn't there for them enough. However, they grew up to be wonderful, happy, smart people with good marriages and family lives, and me? Well, I survived. So I guess I'd say that they are successes on their own merit - but I claim them, because I'm their mom, and I can! Thanks for asking!

I was really depressed for many years after my break-up, so when I completed my BCA, I came to Hyderabad to fulfill my dream of studying in NIFT. My brother and his wife were living there. I stayed for two years to complete my studies. When I joined NIFT, I was proud and I left behind my sad memories in my hometown so as a gift my brother bought me my first Android phone. I was happy to use it and installed many apps to try. One ofthem was a ebook reading app. During my sleepless nights, I used to read a lot of free e-books. This was 2012. Then I got so busy with my fashion studies that I forgot about anything else. I completed my studies and went to another city to work as designer but due to my health issues, I came back to my hometown. Being a self-respected girl, I was feeling like a burden on my family. Though, they never made me feel like that. In my hometown, I started working as a designer/manager in a boutique with a minimum salary. So, it kept me busy, I started laughing a lot, spent good days with my parents but during the night time, my mind was quite active. Every night till 3 am, either I was watching movies/series on laptop or listening to music or I was reading e-books. Suddenly, one night, I thought of a story that I imagined to share but I was quite hesitated first but then, on the same ap,p I started writing, I don't know why but I never expected anyone to read it. After writing few chapters like someone writes on their diary, one night I got a notification that someone liked and commented on my last written chapter. I checked and saw that someone has written, “wow, what an un-usual story, I am liking and eager to know what is gonna happen next, please update the next chapter soon.” I felt like, I got an oscar for best writer. This encouraged me so much that I kept on writing and from one to two and then two to twenty thousand readers started liking my book. This was totally unexpected and overwhelming. I didn't realise but within a year, I became an author though I never ever dreamt of it. My book ranked #1 in romance, drama, interracial loverstory categories. I was jumping like a monkey on my bed but i didn't know who to share this secret of mine because no one knew in my family that now their daughter & sister is an author. Gathering all my courage, I told my sister in law and brother, they were totally amused. My mother too knew about my secret writing skills, she started reading my e-book too. I was feeling a little awkward because obviously, it was a romantic story and I was shy to share it with my family. But, after reading few chapters, my brother told me. “Stupid, why are you writing for free, never give your time, talent and hardwork for free. Publish it on a paid platform.” After editing my book completely, I decided and publish my book on Kindle. After a month, I got my first payment. It was ₹4200. I couldn't believe my eyes, I called my brother and cried a lot and said thank you to him for guiding me. My mother got the news and she was happy then finally I told my dad that, “I am an author and lots of people are buying my book, I don't know how.” My father smiled and proudly said. “It's genes, you never know when it will work.” P.S. My father is a retired radio announcer, he was a drama artist, singer and also a painter. He had written science fictions, poems and many books. He plays flute too. I am a good illustator, an art lover, an okay okay singer and now an author! With my readers heavy demands, I am writing the second book which is a spin-off story to the first one. And soon, I will publish that too. This one is my book. ☺️ Pujari, Shriya: Amazon.in: Kindle Store

Well to answer the question in technical aspect of value of time & essence. One has to think in quadruple ways if not think in square all possible outcomes in terms of plans A,B,C & D. I was working in my career profession but saw inevitably that i would be let go contract terminated. Therefore I thought what can I do outside of my work yet keep my I.T. skills in computers? Back in those days several years ago from now that Youtube was popping up just about in every field of subject, yes I thought of turning myself into a YouTuber. There are 24 hours in a day how one utilizes them whether in bad to good instances of any situation is totally upto you in comparison to logging on to facebook often? I am not in anyway against facebook or anything but my facebook is my youtube I suppose. Yes certainly there are many facebook profiles popular than my youtube but I would never trade my youtube for popular facebook account of someone’s. It took me 4 years instead of 6 months as I initially thought to fully understand background internal workings of the concept of YouTube videos. Back to our scenerio of 24 hours a day, now I completely feel the heat for being the Youtuber that I am I couldn’t cherish to value the utilization of time in any given day! There simply aren’t that many hours for post production to research on topic at any given day. I am glad I am YouTuber and delighted I made the decision to pick up the skill-set.

Raising my kids as a single mom - who had a Narcissistic Personality Disorder-ed ex who never took his Bi-polar meds and was either drunk or very mean; and also devalued the boys to their face and me to the boys all the time. We didn't have supervised visitation in those days. He scared me to death. It was like living in what I imagine a war zone would be like: dodging verbal bombings at all hours of the day and nights. I'm finally becoming able to shake off all the intrusive thoughts, triggers, and heartbreaks I lived through because of the horrible way he treated the children - and myself. When I close my eyes at night, it's finally quiet and peaceful, instead of filled with the echoes of his ugliness.

My biggest achievement in life is on professional front which is clearing Chartered Accountancy at the age of 22 and be a member of esteemed group of Chartered Accountants with Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. Clearing India’s toughest professional course Chartered Accountancy which has a pass percentage as low as 8–10% isn't a cake walk because it requires a lot of patience, dedication and perseverance. Being a Chartered Accountant is a matter of pride because there are only 3 Lakhs Chartered Accountants in the world. Certificate which reminds me the hard work that I have put in for four years to achieve it.  Its not just the final exam of Chartered Accountancy where you have to work ur ass off but in the entire journey. CA entrance exam CPT required me to get serious regarding my career in just few months which is a very big transition because I had just completed my schooling. Intermediate stage IPCC required 9 months of sheer dedication because my class timings were from 7 AM to 9 PM almost everyday. After IPCC the real journey started where I was required to do three years of article-ship from 10:30 AM to 6 PM along with my college. Article-ship gave me practical expsoure in various fields like Audit, Taxation, Finance and Accounting. The last and the biggest hurdle in my journey of becoming a Chartered Accountant was the final exam which required 6 months of studying and staying at home. It tested my patience and dedication. My perseverance lead me to become a Chartered Accountant. Biggest Achievemnet of my Life.  Thank you Kindly Upvote, Share & Follow Irfaan Rangwala

Overcoming my stage fear and gaining self confidence I was in 10th std, the last month of attending school, it was normal day until this: Our class teacher, (English Teacher) entered in class to announce the farewell party. Yeahhhh,( that day came when my parents won’t force me to go to school) I was happy, giggling with my friends, but I don’t know-how, The teacher yell my name, I stood up immediately and all the class went silent. Every student in my class was staring at me( 160 eyes, including teacher’s). And our teacher, ordered me( literally?) to give a farewell speech ( in front of the school) and that’s also in ENGLISH??? It was like a nightmare come true( as I was so shy, that some of my classmates didn’t even know that I exist in class and giving the speech in front of whole school was definitely the nightmare). After that evening, returning to home, avoiding 100 of gazes from my ‘classmates’, I came up with a brilliant solution. “Bunking for that day”. But I don’t know why I brush off that idea from my mind. For the first time in life, I felt that someone assigned me a great responsibility, so I worked on my ‘nightmare’- yeah means speech in English. After doing 1000’s of rehearsals, in front of the mirror, my friends, and the whole class. I was ready to give the speech. With full confidence, I went on the stage, looking at everyone, without hesistation I started my speech. But yeah, a twist came, I skip one passage and then I was unable to remember anything from my speech. For 1 minute I was looking at the crowd in front of me, confused. But then I brushed off the speech layout from my mind and said all the true feelings about my friends, teachers, and school. And after completing my speech, a loud applaude make my hearing senses weak. But that moment I felt so much proud of myself. ( Yeah, self-confidence saved me that day) And guess what? I won the prize from my principle for giving a great speech( I know some thoughts from my speech was not appreciated( but it was the reality) For the first time, I spoke in front of the masses what I felt. Hence that day I gain self-confidence which is the best accomplishment of my life.

Saving someone’s life. There was a girl I got talking to at work. She was so beautiful, a real head turner. I became a good friend of hers and she started calling me late at night. Though I thought this both strange and flattering I suddenly realised inside she was a complete mess. Nearly everyday she would call in tears, upset at the most trivial things. The conversation would get darker and darker until she would talk of suicide. Friends asked why I put up with this but I knew all I had to do was listen, which cost me nothing. This continued for years until one day, she seemed to have fixed herself. It felt strange no longer getting calls and I have to admit I was worried. About 5 years later I was walking through central London late at night when a car stopped. It was her. She called me over and there was a very handsome man in the front and a gorgeous little girl in the back, her husband and daughter She got out the car and walked with me a bit. As we parted she told she cried and told me how our late night chats saved her life and really made her want to live again.

In his 36 years of service as a college professor, not even once he was late to the college, nor had food outside. I was a woman gymnast balancing my domestic and professional responsibilities to the maximum extent possible. Only I had to do the cooking . In my office I had to tackle three- pronged attack of anti feminism, anti brahmanism and anti talentism. I am blessed with two children and professionally reached the highest position possible - Dean and a Syndicate Member. This is because of God's grace, some family support and my hard work. I can go on adding , please refer to my response to similar questions asked earlier.

But on the other hand, I hurt their feelings sometimes. I had been a total menace to many. For some, I was like a hell and unbearable. Even though, I had a very good circle of friends around me most of the time. or I should say, I used to have friends. I never had a personal life apart from them or apart from my family. But then due to some bad decisions, I was left alone on my own. You can see me with friends or Relatives or Colleagues. But I am always a loner to keep my worst nightmares with me. I stayed continuously employed doing technical work I enjoyed for 40+ years. I've been married to the same woman since 1975 and both our lives are better because we've been married to each other. We've saved enough to live comfortably in retirement.  But not enough that we'd still be comfortable without US Social Security and Medicare.

In terms of Zakir Khan- “Mujhe apne kismet pe poora bharosa hai” (I trust my luck). #Sarcasm   They say, even the best laid plans can fail. Even before I could properly begin my trip, Murphy caught me.  Snowstorms and landslides crippled North Sikkim tours and I had to adapt my travel plans. That’s the best part about solo trip - Do whatever the hell you want to. My hostel friends suggested I go to Pelling.  So off to Pelling I went. I had no idea how to reach or what to do there. Long story short, I managed to find a great hostel, made good friends with other backpackers and experienced totally new food.  Pelling has a glass skywalk, a mini version of the Zhangjiajie Glass Bridge. So, there is this deceptive sign that says - Skywalk 1.5Km ahead. Like most Indians, I assumed 1.5 Km corresponds to approx 30 mins because of the hilly area. Had I known earlier, I probably would have bailed out. Because that 1.5km took me nearly an hr. Ok, fine, I admit, I am not in my fittest shape and my heart sucks. But still, I did NOT expect a whole frigging hour.  0:00-0:30 0:00-0:30 0:00-0:30 0:00-0:30 0:00-0:30 Finally after an arduous climb of at least an hour, I managed to get to the top and got rewarded a grand view.     My achievement: I did not give up halfway and continued to trudge ahead. Adios, Jayit Ghosh

It is very important in your life to count your blessings and feel good about your achievements. That will give you positive aura which gives more success in your life. Psychologists around the world say make a habit of thanking God for what you got in life instead of always thinking about what you lack, and I firmly believe in that. There will be few things in life, you feel proud of yourself. They may not be notable achievements in the eyes of other people. But for myself, they are great achievements and I am proud of them.  In March 2018, there was a Pinkathon Run, conducted by Supermodel and Founder of Pinkathon, Milind Soman for Breast Cancer awareness. My brother called me and said he and his wife are participating in that and asked me to join. I was not sure whether I could walk 5 kilometers at a stretch, as I had back and knee issues for the past one year. But I have decided that I will give it a try and said yes to my brother. I reached the venue at 5.30 am in the morning and I could not believe my eyes. There were so many women gathered there and my brother was a volunteer, as men are not allowed to participate in that run. I was overwhelmed when I saw the energy outburst there. I could have felt sorry if I did not say yes to participate in that event. I was carried away with the magnitude of the event and completed my 5 km run without a break. I am so proud of my achievement and always cherish it as a great milestone in my life. It gave me confidence that I can achieve anything if I really want to.

This answer is not about bragging but I would say how I overcame all through… I am the only girl who secured distinction in my 10th standard in our family (both mom's and dad's side)Thank god, I was allowed to study, yea , my dad's side people didn't like me going for higher studies. They were ready to get me married to an illeterate had I stopped studying engineering.After the recovery of terrible accident, One of our family friends demotivated me not to pursue journalism because i was crippled mentally. All thanks to mom, I pursued and worked in media for a while.I saved my family by knowing wrong intentions of our relatives. Wondering how? I learnt IT security. Nobody knew, why family had put an end to toxic people. I am proud of it.One of the good things happened to me is “my Oswald”, he heard my story how people ill treated me, how people looked me down,how terribly I was criticized. Lucky me!!!!

I was a straight-A student in elementary school. Then I realized it doesn’t matter one bit, everyone is granted a place in junior high anyway. I became the club champion in sailing (Optimist and Europe class). Then I entered a big competition and realized I’m actually bad. I had the highest average grade in junior high, three years in a row. Later I realized I could just as well have spent my time like my friends. I became the national champion in Orienteering in men under 20 years. Then I realized I’m nowhere near the international level. I made it to the world cup in Orienteering. There I realized I’m among the worst in the field.  I’m not really sure where I’m going with this. I guess life is a hill you climb. It doesn’t matter if you take the stairs, like I did, or walk beside it. What matters in the end is how high you go.

To have reached at 79 happiness and god, even in reversed order. It was a very hard thing first to understand what happiness and god really were and then try through washing and rinsing of my soul and mind to reach the point in which I could say : that’s it. Now for the curious: happiness of the first class is made of dreams and experiences that we have in part apparently forgotten or not remarked, while they are very alive in us. The day that you experience true happiness you change for the better and become stronger.(I realized this after having done unconsciously what I needed to do to be happy) I write god with a common letter as a riverside hyperbole from the religious word. The god that I found is real and in everything that makes the universe including you and me. This is the most significant success of my life “ NON PLUS ULTRA”

I replied "Happiness, joy, fulfilment, inner peace, harmony, self-love, spiritual awakening, the purpose of life, magical relationships, great friends & family." But she wasn't happy with my answer. She said I am asking about valuable stuff like material things, money, business or job and things like that. I replied "Yes, I told you the most valuable things I have achieved in life. Along with that, I have long list things including those you mentioned but I am telling you the most valuable things in life. Unless you achieved what's most valuable.. rest everything isn't enough." You don't have to always identify yourself with your job or designation or with the money you have made or the things you have acquired. They are definitely an integral part of life and sooner or later you will have them all. However, if you are not achieving the most valuable things in life which are always intangible then none of the things that you achieved is going to give you have a blissful life.

My kids. I should not have been able to have kids due to meds but three kids later. I have written many a heart wrenching pro and some whimsical ones as well. Built an awesome fort in the yard for the kids using the wood from my old kitchen. Put in a new kitchen. Clearwd half an acre with a chainsaw. Re entered school 6yrs after quitting to get my grade 12 and went on to collage afterward. Invented a few new items but could not market them as they fell under existing pattens. Built a huge shed in my yard and transported kids for to cottage to use as a shop.Worked with seniors 4yrs. A lot of little things but busy things. Nothing world changing but life living.

There are a plenty and it is hard for me to decide which one stands out. My score of 71.4% in 10th class, knowing very well I was not studious but worked really hard as I jumped from 8th to 10th and did not study 9th. This was to make up the lost 1 year as I failed in 2nd standard and was made to study another year in the same class.My first car. Maruti OMNI van. I had many family emotions attached with it but after using it for 10 years, gifted it to my brother.The letter which I got as a reply from Maneka Gandhi who was the pioneer of running a society called People for animals. This was when I was just a kid, perhaps 12 of age.My 2 - BHK flat measuring 1250 sq.feet. Bought for 25 lacs although on home loan (have few more years before it gets completely repaid).My new maruti wagon-R .My first bike , Apache 150 RTR.My teams which used to report into me. Literally everyone grew professionally and personally. I feel proud of them. Few of them are in Quora too.My daughter's 87% pass mark in her 10th CBSE. Nothing less than my achievement although it was her accomplishmen.My wife completed her 10 years of teaching service in DPS. (I am the culprit who encouraged her to work and she has come a long way since then). So you can call me narcissist.We would be celebrating our 19th wedding anniversary in November. You must be wondering what's the big deal? Well - we rarely fight. We have our difference of opinions though but we sort it out amicably. While there is nothing glorifying in this, let me tell you, we have seen the ups and downs of life and have toiled to come at this stage. I have never abused my wife physically or emotionally. Although she takes very good care of me, I take the credit.These are just a few that I could think of at the moment and I shall add further if I recollect any. Wishing you most and more.

“UNDERSTANDING CAPACTIY” My biggest achievement was when I learnt to feel other’s pain. I never could yet I did. If a child could starve himself to feed the children on road with his tiffinbox,why shouldn’t I ?If he could do atmost possibile thing to help his struggling backstabbing friend,maybe just to ignite humanity in him ,then why shouldn’t I? If he could stand for everything he has chosen under every circumstances,why shouldn’t I ?Why shouldn’t I feel it like he did?If an emotionally tortured child could handle it,I didn’t try it,he kind of made me do it without my consent. I felt everything then after. I realized to feel things in real is painful yet required.

Hi friend, Remember one thing in life, That achievement in not important to become a successful person in life. We can be a great personality among others if we done some Achievements, but what about your life? Is your life happy? Is your life going smoothly? Is your life is worth living? Is your life is without any problems because of your achievements? If we ask to a person who achieved will definitely answer as “NO” So my advice is concentrate on things which gives you peace and happiness. My greatest achievement is Giving alms to the poor.Helping and obeying my parents in all things.Doing social servicesPlaying with friends every evening without fail.These are the works which i do everyday thinking as an achievement in my life. It gives me peace and happiness to lead a successful life. Sorry friend if i mentioned anything wrongly. Thank you, With regards, Jasper devadoss

I think going to another level of creation is mine, I was pleased and could really feel there and it was peaceful. The worlds made by the creator, to see these, the Great mystics told us of them, I once believed that these guys were wacko ,I thought that it was all a “put-on” to sell books, or to get people into their following. noooo. It's real. I have never discussed the means of doing this type of travel with any of the classically trained backers of the methods but It was managed after I afire while simply awake, to meet other beings. “ “Easy Journey To Other Planets” was to me, like some kind of joke, a book I saw when I was young, but it was as if they took me by the hand and helped a crippled Western thinking moron and gave him the license to go anywhere. I think of this as my best. Asking and receiving is truly wonderful, but time spent in another world with a citizen of another plane that is also the Father's creation? That's just beyond anything I call my own, even as it is a shared event. They have feelings too, the sad face of the slight female being , as I was being taken back home, was hard to handle. It was the only time I saw that look, you do not want to sense her kind suffering, especially over you, you do not want to have any part of it. The travel It is at once a great gift, and A great accomplishment. What can be better?

So,here I go:- I got my selection in physiotherapy course of Delhi university with AIR 23!!!!…….AND so my college is one of top 5 physiotherapy colleges in India!!!!Till 4 years ,I was not able to speak ,so I was a huge introvert in my school …but now, I am open to interact with new people who I came across!!!!I did my bachelor in instrumental music which of 5 years !!!!I became a international player,national -level umpire and and instructor after achieving 2nd degree black belt in taekwondo and at that time I was the Delhi's youngest female 2 degree black belt holder!!!!I am able to see my parents happy and satisfied !!!!!I have some great friends who are always there in my life!!!!!I always wanted to do social work ,so I got tge oppurtunity to beco me a member of organ donation society of ucms!!!!:)And lastly, i am fully happy and satisfied with what I have gained and achieved and thanking God for all these events happened to me till now!!!:)Be happy!!!:)

There are several that are all linked I left my family home at 13, put myself through school until I finished grade 10 and have been independent ever since. I have made and lost fortunes along the way. I went to university when I was 38 years old and after graduation I got to do what I had wanted to really do my whole life. I was quite successful and got to travel to some wonderful places, but the road was pretty rocky along the way. I met my beautiful highly intelligent caring wife and have enjoyed that journey. My biggest success? Always I maintained my sense of determination to be honest and have a regard for and to find ways to help others even when I was not treated the same way.

Hmm. I do not really like to pass time thinking of my "triumphs". Those are so relative, anyway. Like: Was it a triumph that I helped my brother stay alive until his late 30's with his mental illness and our horrible parents pulling him down? Or was it a failure that he still ultimately murdered his wife and killed himself? And why rank my accomplishments as if one is greater than another? I have earned degrees, certificates, etc., in a variety of areas. But why would one necessarily be my "biggest triumph"? And, while those certainly build my confidence, they cannot entirely fulfill my sense of self-worth. I prefer to be a human being versus a human doing. I know that is a radical concept! But I do hope to come to terms in some fashion with some of my feelings of disdain toward humanity (of which I am a part) before the end of my life.

THE ORIGINAL QUESTION WAS, “WHAT WAS THE BEST ACHIEVEMENT…”. There is no “best” in life, everything is in shades of grey or uniquely valuable, so, I’ll comment of the various “achievements” or mileposts in my life. Luck was part of the reason but my most cherished accomplishment is not what my intellect and work have done but what my spiritual/emotional being has achieved. I made the right choice of mate in my 20’s and worked to keep the relationship relevant, interesting and trusting for over 30 years. For that accomplishment, I feel greater satisfaction than any professional achievement or monetary gain. My priorities in life: Mental/Physical Health >> Personal Intimate Relationship >> Life Balance >> Professional Accomplishment >> Monetary Gain Personal LifeAddressed a psychological condition that has hampered me since childhoodCultivated a very long-term (35+ years) personal relationship and become best friends with my partner.Culture and Education AchievementsMoved to a foreign country where I not only learned the language well enough to live, but also to work in the linguistically-demanding publishing business, something even native speakers could find challenging.Acquired higher education degrees in three countries including Bachelors, Masters and Doctorate.ProfessionalWorked as a liberal professional and as an international executive in four countries, affording me, in my youth, world travel under luxurious circumstances and an intellectually-challenging work atmsphere.Proved my productive worth to qualify for citizenship in the USA and in France.

The best goal I ever set was the goal to not bother about goals in favour of doing things I want to do, are interesting and I enjoy. I’ve successfully achieved this goal for decades. This avoids stresses and strains associated with setting goals including are they the right goals, achievable goals, written down or not and so on. It also avoids stresses and strains associated with achieving goals or not. Instead, the energy that would be used up dealing with the stresses and strains is focussed on doing things I want to do, are interesting, I enjoy, are fulfilling and so on. It can be interesting to ask: Is it absolutely certain your life will somehow be better if you set and achieve goals?Is it absolutely certain your life will be worse if you don't set and achieve goals?If you do things that interest you and you enjoy but don’t set goals for, are you certain it will always end in failure?If you don’t set goals and do things that interest you and you enjoy, will any success be somehow less because you have not set goals?What is it, what knowledge and influences, have led to my answer for the above questions? As children, we do and achieve things without knowing what a goal is, so where does our need for goal setting come from?If goal setting works for you, great! If not, doing what you want and enjoy has an equal likelihood of ending in success.

This will probably sound corny to everyone but oh fucking well. My best achievement so far in my life is easily becoming a United States Marine. I went from being a sloppy obese fat fuck to a Marine. If I hadn’t done that I’d still be obese today. I am so thankful I did it. And I also surprised myself because not only was I able to become a Marine in the first place I was able to thrive and excel at it and be a great Marine. You never know what you can do unless you fucking do it. I fully expected to fail at it and not be able to hack it. Boy was I wrong. I found out that I love misery!

As of now ! In October 2016 I had my college Technical festival and a Pokemon Go was at the peak of hype. So as I am a video game developer , my college CTO asked me to develope a Pokemon themed multiplayer game for the fest to attract more people. Me and my 2 other friends worked day and night and developed a Pokemon Battle Simulator in 37 days . The game is for PC platform and is Lan multiplayer. The game lets player play as a Pokemon against the other player(which is a pokemon) and use different attacks and powers to battle with the opponent. The event was successful and we won a medal for it. Till date its my biggest achievement as I was able to conquer a challenge which seemed impossible and faced many problems but still was able to overcome them.

Not sure if this was my greatest but one month I signed up more customers for credit cards than any other cashier and got a full-size upright classic 16 in one video arcade system which would have been 400 US dollars new but I sold for $200 as a floor demo model to a friend for a tax free bonus that month!! It was a demo!!! I was number one at signing up custmors for credit and debit cards at one the top retail stores in the US in an ironic cruel twist of fate I was recently fired a few weeks ago after nearly 21 years total on the job the last probably 12 as cashier at same store location all nearly 21 years!! My goal was 22 years which would have been have been half my life!! I didn't just lose most my income On lost all my friends alot of my reasons to get out of bed my sense of purpose my pride whole whole Identity as a Target cashier for the first few days after being fired I was too depressed to even leave the house!!!

Thank you so much beta! Muahh! You're my best Chandu! -said my Maa. :) It was a busy day. Too much hustle and bustle everywhere. We had some guests who had arrived recently at home. Everyone was busy in their hospitality. :D I too had my college that day. I had to leave early. As everyone was way too busy, I decided to help. I went to kitchen, started shaping some of the Pooris[1]. Later, I ended in frying some of the puffed Pooris too. Then, I was dressed up for my college. Maa called- 'Where are you going? You haven't eaten anything yet. Wait!' I said- 'Maa, I have already fried some of the Poori(s). Just serve me some. ' She smiled - Thank you so much beta! Muahh! You're my best Chandu! She kissed me on my cheeks. It was a pure bliss! I was satisfied that she was happy. :) Footnotes[1] poori recipe or puri recipe, how to make pooris | indian poori recipe

Being a great Dad. As Jacqueline Kennedy said and I loosely quote “if you don't get your kids right nothing else matters”. I’ve had personal success in business and have started 6 businesses, but being a Dad is more fulfilling in so many ways than professional or material accomplishment. Raising two young men who are honest, honorable, open minded, and having great senses of humor as well as being respectful of women would be my greatest success as well as joy. Are they perfect? No, but no one, including me, is. But creating two people who can contribute to life and society as well as enjoy it themselves will always be my biggest life success!

I need to first tell you that this answer is going to be long & at some point I can't describe what I felt. So please read every word till the end. Because you will get what is the best part of the answer. Till now I really don't have that big achievements like other achievers. But I have some achievement that is best thing I have done. It was in 11th grade. Everyone was happy with their semester 1 result. I was also happy because I also got good marks. But I thought that if I enjoy with this marks I will get only one good marksheet; but to get more good marksheet like that I continue my preparation & also increase my reading hours.(In 1st sem we only had 100 MCQ while in 2nd sem we had to answer 50 marks questions & 50 marks for MCQ. So 2nd semester is tough for most.)So with good strategy & reading preparation I got increament in marks. Most of students were saying that mathematics paper was very hard. Also many students were getting marks less than 33 in maths. But due to more practice & love with maths I got 98 out of 100, which was great achievement because I got 1st rank merit wise in my hostel. I was happy. Also I got good marks in chemistry which was not my subject. After seeing result I thought “Now I know how it feel after doing hard work & staying patient with other feelings.” On next day of result we went for movies (all hostel boys, which was preplanned), where also our mathematics sir was present and he said in front of everyone,”Neel, te maru naak kapata bachavi lidhu(you saved my reputation).” So yeah that was my one achievement. After all this, in 4th semester my school organized a science fair & we created a model of dam -”Sardar sarovar dam”. So I was very happy that we created that model about 2 metre * 1 metre. We created that thing from wood & then we coated with a plastic that can prevent water likage, because we made a working model of flowing water from damn. We also bought a statue of Mr. Sardar Patel of 3000rs. Yes you read it right,3000rs. So we enjoyed that project because it was made after using different techniques for likage proof, electric work for lighting & pumping of water, instruments, gums, cellotapes. We were really tired after that two days fair. But also happy. This was my second achievements. I don't have pic of project but I have a picture of my group.  Now, my third and most best achievement is just before science fair our school organized an event for prize distribution for 3rd semester. In which I was also selected. For that two year my father & our principal(also physics professor) were knowing each other very goodly. So at event he called my father on stage for his review. He said that he was happy to get me into that school, he was very happy with my marks & that school had very good strategy to teach students. I was like “he is very happy with me, what else in world I want from life.” So these are my achievements. And last one seeing your own parents happy with you is the best one.

My children are my greatest achievement in my life, they are my miracles and I love them so much. I looked at them everyday whether on Instagram, snap chat or when we spent times together I am amazed how they developed into the best people that I know. We went through a lot of turmoil during and after my divorced but they knew that I love them and their father love them the best way that he knew how. Since they are 21 and 19 years old they have their own lives and I make sure that they know that I am so proud of them. My other achievements was when I bought a home with my mother for her and my siblings. Also when I helped the father of my children to purchased a home for his parents and our children. I like to help others because I get so much happiness, therefore I will continue to build others as long as I am alive.

My greatest achievement would most likely be surviving the last 4 horrible years. I couldn’t find a job to pay the bills and I couldn’t keep up with all of my great relationships. I think that he who makes it to tomorrow can eventually make their dreams come true. It is important to keep the future in mind. As a young person my life was filled with awards and achievements, but at that age they are more prevalent. I cannot pick one of those, they were just confidence builders. The simple answer would likely be landing a great job in the oil patch, it paid for many great things in my life and I got to see much of North America because of it. It took a lot of hard work and some public speaking which I wasn’t used to.

My biggest success would be if I can control my instincts which did happen. So, I always wanted to lose weight by atleast 10 kg but was unable to do so because of travelling in job and office is far away from home.  Finally, i have decided to give it a shot and i had done my homework about diet and physical activity as well as calorie requirement. I was doing all my stuff as earlier but just added 1 hour of walking and jogging daily without fail. After 3 weeks time result started to show which motivate me further to continue the same. After 8 months of continuous effort i finally acheived my target. Note: This was achieved without any professional help and gym. While doing so i have achieved control over food habbits, sleep and laziness which paved the way for my success. So, I count this as my biggest success.

Art is my passion and I think that it is my greatest glory. I’ve always been into arts, may it be drawing, painting (not much), crafts, and now, paper cut art. It is something that have always been with me since I was a kid. I am not that good with it but since I am enjoying doing so, nothing can stop me from doing it. Well, it is something that is common among my brothers and I but they never pursue this one and the reason is unknown to me. What makes me proud are those that I’ve made. Even without being paid for it, the accomplishment upon finishing an art work has always been something that I am looking forward to. The feeling would always be overwhelming that I wanted to dance but since I cannot save my life to dance, just smirking like a mad man would be the replacement.
