response.answer_text: for a long time in my life i wished i could have everything going by my wishes and i’m glad that even the saying goes” you cant have it all at once” but i’m grateful to God that most of my wishes have been granted. when i was a scholar i always wanted to make sure that i go to college/university and pursue my studies and further make a choice of my lifetime work. you cant just believe what happened to me just this year. this year i’m 23 years old. on January i was called to probation as a sales lady in my work place.a probation of about 6 months. Before i could even finish my probation i was granted a scholarship by the same company to go and study IT which is what i’m still doing right now.after the 6 months i was permanently hired and soon after that i got married to my dream man. now i am 3 months pregnant and starting a family already. so you can just count it: job, scholarship, marriage and a child i guess its more that i have even dreamt of.

Convincing my wife to marry me. It sounds silly when I write it like that, particularly since it wasn’t some kind of protracted negotiation, but I’m entirely certain - even more than 5 years later - that I’m batting not just above my average, but entirely in another league, by having her around. Not only that, but I’m absolutely certain that I wouldn’t be where I am now without her. She was the first person other than me to think that studying the PhD I’m currently working towards would be a viable thing to do, and that started to persuade my family to get behind the idea and convince me that I should do more than just talk about it. She was also instrumental in getting me through a particularly nasty couple of years before that, to do with job losses and mental illness.

I think sometimes people spend their whole life earning money and fame. No doubt, money is necessary for living but it is not the thing that is the biggest achievement according to me. The biggest achievement according to me is everyone around you is happy with you. Your relations with all of your friends and family members are in that phase which can not be anything better. You are happy with everyone as you have learnt to forget small things and cherish the importance of your life. You might be facing failures but that does not bother or affect you mentally and your social impact remais as it is. You have some impactful remarks when you are speaking in a group or a community. And lastly you have no regrets for what you have done so far. You have made your own rules and you have capitalized on it. This, according to me, is the biggest achievement in life because at the end of the day , you want to become an ideal human being. ( A good One, better than many, perhaps the best one ) Thanks, Meet Patel.

As it is written in bhagvad geeta… Dhyaayato vishayaan pumsah sangas teshupajaayate;Sangaat sanjaayate kaamah kaamaat krodho'bhijaayate. Meaning-. When a man thinks of the objects, attachment to them arises; from attachment desire is born; from desire anger arises. Krodhaad bhavati sammohah sammohaat smriti vibhramah;Smritibhramshaad buddhinaasho buddhinaashaat pranashyati. Meaning - From anger comes delusion; from delusion the loss of memory; from loss of memory the destruction of discrimination; From the destruction of discrimination he perishes. Raagadwesha viyuktaistu vishayaanindriyaishcharan;Aatmavashyair vidheyaatmaa prasaadamadhigacchati. Meaning- But the self-controlled man, moving amongst objects with the senses under restraint, and free from attraction and repulsion, attains to peace. Prasaade sarvaduhkhaanaam haanir asyopajaayate;Prasannachetaso hyaashu buddhih paryavatishthate. Meaning- In that peace all pains are destroyed, for the intellect of the tranquil-minded soon becomes steady. (When peace is attained all miseries end.) Naasti buddhir ayuktasya na chaayuktasya bhaavanaa;Na chaabhaavayatah shaantir ashaantasya kutah sukham. Meaning- There is no knowledge of the Self to the unsteady, and to the unsteady no meditation is possible; and to the un-meditative there can be no peace; and to the man who has no peace, how can there be happiness? Indriyaanaam hi charataam yanmano'nuvidheeyate;Tadasya harati prajnaam vaayur naavam ivaambhasi. Meaning- For the mind which follows in the wake of the wandering senses, carries away his discrimination as the wind (carries away) a boat on the waters. What is your biggest achievement in life? I haven't achieved it yet but I desire to accomplish the state of perpetual motion. I want to attain peace of mind(Well,who doesn't?). Which in way means no gloominess,no stress,no depression. Note- In no way I am promoting any religion or book. In fact I am an “agnostic atheist”. I read religious books just to impart moral values and most importantly to get motivation (which in my opinion are as good as ted talks or sandeep maheswari are).

My most rewarding  achievements in life are as follows: Learning to love myself as I am, while understanding that the purpose of love is to become a better person; Forming solid life-long friendships with several amazing people; Completing my degree in philosophy and building a life that allows me to develop and practice philosophy (Examples: Alexi Helligar | Florida State University | Papers); Discovering that Society is God and a set of Core Values that express that understanding. (Examples: How can we define God? and What are the requirements for a truly free, utopian society?); Discovering the structure of consciousness (Example: Oh Me! Oh Life — On Consciousness and Immortality); Creating a collection of poetry and visual art (Examples: Do we move because of time? and Some examples of Alexi Helligar's artwork?); Becoming more patient.

Building a business from scratch, without any considerable investment. I started my business by saving a bit of money from my salary each month. I did it by: First by teaming up with a friend who was working at a small-scale company and who knew how the business operated.With basic information on hand, we built a simple site that didn’t cost a fortune.While doing our jobs, we gradually worked on the website and on our services.This took some time, but it was a safe route.We received our first order by the end of the first year.We left our jobs by the end of its second year as we had started making enough money that could meet our personal expenses.Having met our personal expenses through business, we successfully started making profits and making reinvestment into expanding the business.Instead of thinking about big businesses, one should focus on small-scale services that can be done without much much effort, money and time. What about you (question to the one who started this post lol) ?

I knew my answer within 5 seconds of mental debate. Mine is value. I know value now. I understand it. I know how to use and measure value. Relationships, what I want, what someone said, it all has a certain value and I now know how to value and make decisions based on value. Everything in our lives, little matters to big matters, all have their own value at which we determine what to do with those matters. We make life choices and think about our value. We think about how important it is for us to do something and how much value doing something is. I value my schooling. But do I value it over sitting and watching movies all day? Do I value movies over my GED? No. What we value and being able to accomplish an understanding of value is what makes life a little easier and more manageable.

Being able to put a smile on my parents’ faces every now and then Be it for my academics or my manners or my wit or the fact that I am happy. Other achievements?? Mastering the art of living away from my parents( though “mastering” is taking it too far); being able to read more than 10 novels in under 5 months; being the member of the group who can eat the most spicy and others. P.S.: No I didn’t mention any academics related achievements because they are materialistic and I don’t think too highly of them. I’m happy and content with my life, whilst being ambitious at the same time. Its one of the major achievements of my life.

In my ranking system, the second greatest ever achievement was mine. I once agreed to write a TV ad script for my Creative Director by lunchtime - and then immediately forgot. After a pleasant morning online shopping and constructing a hat made entirely of blu-tack, he popped by my desk again mid-afternoon. ‘That script… I need to get it over to client…’ He clocked my blu-tack hat. ‘…you have done it?…’ I panicked and said yes. Like an idiot, I even managed to sound a little affronted at the suggestion. ‘Email it over. I need to send it.’ He walked off. The distance between his desk and mine was twenty-seven steps. I started typing. I came up with the idea around the 7th step, had the first draft written by about the 22nd step, and had proof-read it and formatted it by about four seconds after he had sat down - it was in his inbox when he opened his laptop. But the greatest ever achievement was Norman Borlaug. He was a member of the American Wrestling Hall of Fame.  Iowa Wrestling Hall of Fame National Wrestling Hall of Fame And that’s not all. Even more impressively, he also developed new crops, and won a Nobel Prize for his work, because good old Norman saved an estimated billion lives. Yep, a billion. So it seems a shame few people even know his name. But then, he didn’t brag about it on Quora. Norman Borlaug - Wikipedia

Naima, this question is hard to answer. Aside from saving lives and giving direct care to demented people, I’ve written 3 novels, short stories, and several volumes of poetry. I hitchhiked from Belgium to India, built a cabin in the woods with no power tools, and so forth. But these things, though interesting, aren’t truly great. Saving people’s lives is very good, but other people can claim that as well. Becoming a balanced human being has certainly paid off. When I was about 25, I took to heart the teaching of Carl Jung, the eminent Swiss psychiatrist, who explained that each of us is half male and half female, and that the realized human being awakens and blends the subordinate half. This makes us step outside gender constructs while still feeling comfortable with them. Awakening my female half made me an excellent listener and a decent actor (because I’m not emotionally frozen). The result is, that after decades of floundering, I now have excellent social skills.

Experiencing the fact that life is full of self fulfilling prophecies. Your thoughts create the world around you because you look for things to confirm the beliefs you hold. To break it down - the thoughts you hold influences the way you perceive and interact with the world, your perceptions determine your mood, your mood can determine the quality of your life and your actions bring you closer to the goals you believe are attainable. If you believe that the universe is friendly and that the world is full of beauty and wonder, you can train yourself to see the good in situations and people regardless of what other people may perceive them to be, when you do this your interactions become more positive, your mood elevates and your quality of life is unreal. This is antithetical to what we are socialized to believe - that there are objectively ‘good’ and ‘bad’ things that can happen to us. And that the quality of our life is determined by whether these external situations are overall more ‘good’ or ‘bad’. Really any given situation is neither ‘good’ nor ‘bad’, those are labels we ascribe primarily as a result of our socialization. Resilience is really just training your mind to focus on the growth and opportunities in any situation. It took me some time, and lot of reading to learn this but achieving internal peace and a state of predominant bliss is something I am extremely grateful for.

I think you are asking if I have achieved satisfaction in my action which has given quality output as per the expectation or more. This also could mean if we are able to satisfy our desire even if that could be in our work life and with minimum vested interest. Yes we would be satisfied in many instance which could be noteworthy but we forget the important portion usually. Generally satisfied feeling we associate with fulfillment of desire which is dependent on results and is remembered because of the result we have in record. The result could be promotion or getting an important order or completing an important milestone. There is also another type of satisfaction which we have experienced many times without having the end result to be recorded. This is when we have worked on a mission or objective, it could be research finding or solving personal problem which has been lingering for years. How did we achieve it? We take the initiative now in addressing seriously (could be a starting thought), be focus and try all that is needed, running pillar to post, search various libraries, surf internet and interface with others to find value and get some direction. The process continues for many weeks or months as the problem could be but in this period we are satisfied many times because we have taken many steps which we would not in normal condition. The determination and focus enables to make ceaseless running we think important and do in search of matter or discuss with others. After the day’s toil we are satisfied, the task is not complete but the effort we have put is satisfying. It is the process we are undertaking actually is satisfying which has hidden power we miss which has a lasting lesson by an aware or alert mind. A wise mind could use the gist in normal condition because next time the situation would be different in a different problem with different types of solution. Similarity could be the nature of focus and readiness to exert all variable we have to try even if that amounts us to move away from our comfort zone. On these grounds yes I have experienced satisfaction many times and even if results were good the goodness of relishing of results were later and minimum but the core for achieving satisfaction has registered to mold the inner nature. Today I have been explain young people at work to experience this type of satisfaction which is so near and which can be a cause of beautiful future without wasting time in expectation at least when it is not needed. What good I have achieved in the end is ‘peace of mind’ that is a result by tracking and maintaining peace more important than the material fruits always. NOTE: The query I have answered was unclear and with words “Have you ever achieved good in your life”. The beginning of my answer may appear sensible only when we can differentiate the original query with the present one in which it is merged.

My father was a freedom fighter & had commanded a warship fleet, during the last war with Pakistan, way back in 1965! He was the Lt Commander of Indian Navy Reserve, along with the Dredger commander of Kandla Port Trust! We were stationed in Gandhidham! However, he survived the war & was rewarded by the Indian Govt with a 8 acre agricultural land in Galpadar, Gujarat, way back in 1975! The land mafia & the local MLA got his papers disappeared from the local office & made a false case of the land being taken back by the local Govt, in lieu of the land not getting cultivated by my father! He had been posted to Haryana from Gujarat & there was no way he could have cultivated the particular land! Also, it wasn’t even fertile, the land! That’s when my father began his struggle to get back what was rightfully his! The legal battle took a dent with his death in 2012. I, being his youngest daughter, took over the case, with both my elder siblings showing no interest in the case! I pursued this diligently, away from my family & kids for long gaps of time, fought fearlessly for something that belonged to my father! Being a single woman, with my husband looking after the kids in Mumbai, I visited old offices practically every day of these long years. I was meted veiled threats from the land mafia, but turned a deaf ear to them! After a relentless struggle, I have managed to regularise the plot with dogged determination & am extremely proud of my own achievement!!

My greatest achievement was in the summer after 9th grade. I was 220 pounds. I don't have a fast metabolism and I didn't exercise a lot when I was younger. I was a fat kid and got made fun of in school because of it. But being called fat repeatedly is what motivated me to lose weight. I went from 220 to 170 in 3 months. 50 pounds. Here's how I did it: I stopped drinking pop. I only ate the serving size of foods. This means when I had lunch, which was a bologna sandwich and chips, I only had 1 slice of bologna, 1 piece of bread, and 11 chips. Instead of grabbing a handful of Doritos I literally counted 11 chips from the bag.I went walking several miles each day at a local park. I also did a whole lot of sit ups gradually increasing the number until at one point, I was doing 800 a night. (Not all at once. I did sit ups at night and did 10 sets while watching TV, doing sit-ups during commercials. So when I did 800, I was doing 10 sets of 80.)

I have three. The vanity one is that almost thirty years ago I won a national chess tournament. I am a pretty good local player, but that result was an incredible outlier. That was her last chance. I was a paid tutor, but she was not one of my students. The most meaningful one is that my wife tells me that she never thought that she could be this happy. My ongoing goal is to make her feel this was as long as we both shall live.

I decided to go back to college. Paid off my credit cards. No car so no expenses for that. I was able to save money for college until I was able to get scholarships. I got 5. Paid 1/3 to 1/2 of the cost. After graduating from my 4 yr degree and having to pay back loans for 14 yrs, it was liberating to walk across that stage and get my AAS, certificate a diploma and have it paid for. I looked for a year to find something combining the degrees. Ended back in retail. Very disappointing. Now after doing years of retail, I have knee and ankle problems that won't allow me to stand long. Walking isn't bad. But standing just hurts to the point that I can't do a 5 or 6 hr shift. Switching gears. Not sure what door God will open. In the meantime, I help a friend I'm living with until then. At least I'm safe, have food and friends caring about me even though I don't feel worthy of friends. I help her. And my friends. I know I need to not give so much because I give too much and end up hurt in the end to the point of not functioning.

I’ve quit multiple jobs at very short spans. Did 4 jobs already and an M.Tech degree. I’m 25 yrs old. I’ve been quite known for doing whatever I wanted to, during and even after my college days. But I have lived quite responsibly. My greatest achievement is that people speak to me when they are extremely stressed and want to quit. By quit, I mean, quit life as well as jobs. When ‘people’ are too lost, depressed, confused, and feel no one can listen to what they feel and want to express, they call me. My greatest achievement is the trust that they put in me. By ‘people’, I mean my teachers, ex-colleagues, friends, friends of friends and random people who’ve just heard about me.

This question was thrown at me when I was a part of training program at an organization. There were around 30–40 trainees answering the same question. I must say all of them were champions, getting highest grades at state level, winning a prestigious match for their college, getting a new car, being placed in an prestigious MNC… These were the several answers from the trainees. I honestly had no answer there speaking up to this question, and it's my turn: “ Honestly speaking I haven't achieved anything in life so far. I didn't top in any exam, remained an average student throughout my career, failed several times, didn't do absolutely outstanding in anything. But I'm extremely overwhelmed speaking here about achievement. There were days when I just hoped that this day Will be the last day for me, there were days when I slept sobbing, there were days when everything remained an uphill for me. Setting all apart I'm here smilingly addressing this Hall. Getting a couple of centuries may be termed as achievement for kohli. Adding few crores to the business may be termed as achievement for Ambani. Spending crores to the charity may be termed as achievement for Tata. Getting a good audience response to any film may be termed as achievement for any actor. For me standing here n sharing these words with you is not less than achievement. THE SCALE OF ACHIEVEMENT HOLDS DIFFERENT TO ALL OF US. : A looser ☯

What is your biggest achievement in life? I AM an in-dependant thinker. The sovereign King of my own existence. I sound the depths of consciousness every day and draw up the riches I find and share them willingly with all those who need them. There is no value to me in ‘academic’ achievements as long as these achievements cause the people to behave in a heinous manner towards those around them. To hoard up ‘material wealth’ while those around them, literally starve to death and have no home. There is no value to achieving ‘qualifications’ and then becoming a prostitute selling to the highest bidder… while one’s core values wither and die. This whole world system is built on these kind of ‘achievements’ and people cannot see how they have been deluded out of experiencing the fullness of et-ernal life. Being an in-dependent thinker means being able to draw directly from the River of the Water of Life which flows directly from the source and learning how to dispense it, wisely, and with love and compassion. Every so called academic ‘achievement’ pales in comparison.

Let me take this as an opportunity to express my gratitude to great teachers who moulded me indirectly or directly. Because these are the greatest things I actually acheived but could not judge ( yet, I do not try to ) that time. First when I was studying matriculation ( Xth standard - last year of High School in India ) one of our teacher used to take tuitions. His name is Deshpande Sir. I never paid his fees ( I think my father used to pay him or may be not. So far I could not gather daring to ask any one of these ) But one day ( in full year !!! ) he could not conduct the tuition class and we returned home surprisingly to our homes. The next morning he entered class with a plastic transparent bag in hand filled with 25 Paisa coins. We wondered what it all was about. Then he started distributing a coin to each student in the class and finished. He went to the his regular table and spoke ‘I am sorry that I could not attend you yesterday, so I return here the one day fee that I charge you for this teaching.’ I don’t explain what I felt at that time. This was the first and most important turning point in my thought process. 10 years back when I could make my own Home, I went to his home ( for the first and last time ) and invited him to inaugurate my Home. he did come and called ( to my surprise again ) a Mantra for continuous 10 minutes !!! I really can’t hold my emotions and gratitude for him. A great teacher. A simplest man in my town and a silent activist. Is that my achievement? May be or may be not, but he taught me and I got 87 marks out of 100 in English without a study of single minute.  There are many more. Some other time. Thanks.

Almost comically earning over a million dollars for retirement and even more comically if I can some how arrange it my moldering corpse could be worth nearly 16 million dollars at the ripe old age of 92. I certainly realize you can’t take all that money with you but I have something of a dream to uplift my family in some fashion and would absolutely bequeath that to a future relative in the hope that it would put them in a position where life would be easier. I certainly won’t care since I’ll be dead but the thought is comforting none the less and I would hope it might lead to better things down the road. Then again that is tempered by the notion that (and I’m paraphrasing here); 1st generation to earn it, 2nd generation to grow it and 3rd generation to blow it.

Married to my bride of 53 years who has been my friend, my guide, whose company I enjoy and she continues to challenge and help me be a better person. And along the way I graduated from 4 years of college, 3 years of theological school, and 3 years of graduate education. All of this from a lad who graduated from high school only because a math teacher changed an F to a D- which allowed me the credit needed to graduate with my class rather than go to summer school. Well this is something, which still brings tears in my eyes :) and I feel HAPPY and BLESSED every time I see her. I hail from a small town of Uttarakhand and have completed my senior secondary (yr 2009) from a Hindi medium school. There was a girl in my class named Tanuja. Schools days were going to end very soon and one day Our class teacher made an announcement that we were going to have a farewell next week. Coincidentally Tanuja was sitting beside me. She was just an acquaintance at that time. We started having a discussion about future goals and I came to know that she was having some financial issues. Imagine! here mother was a cook in a Govt. school, who used to get hardly 2k -3k per month , they were 4 siblings. She was willing to prepare for B-pharma entrance exam but due to no money she wasn’t able to fill the form. Later in evening I discussed the same thing with my mother as I were willing to give her some money for the form. Next day I gave her Rs.200. for form fee but she refused to take. After insisting so much I she took it. FAST FORWARD>> 2012 >> 2014 I lost contact with Tanuja, but since it was a small town, used to get the updates from my mother. Came to know that she cleared the entrance exam with flying colors. Guess what? One day I was returning back to town and saw a small new medical store. The moment I entered there , There was SHE! ! She owned it!! I am soo happy for her. I wish her all good luck This is something which not only I consider as my personal achievement but also it gave me some life lessons Just once CHANCE and hard work can change your life.If you dream for some thing , go for it.You never know, your one help can change people’s lives. So if anywhere , anytime you find some needy . HELP HIM/HER.

It was on 23rd of January, we had our planning forum closing in college. As usual I was asked to come early for some preparations. I went there and was decorating Maa Saraswati's portrait with flowers. Suddenly a professor came to me and asked “ what is your name dear?” Usually I always pronounce my full name but on that I was so consumed in my thoughts that I hardly paid any attention towards her and just said, “Aishwarya, ma'am” then she said, “ Ohoo Aishwarya Rathore, I have heard about you dear but never see you everyone says that you speak extremly good and yesterday I have wrote your name on so many certificates ki mujhe yeh naam yaad ho gaya” then I realised that sometimes I am really good and able to make people remember me.

Well, this may sound fantastical but yes - I used to have dreams where I could run super fast just before floating quite quickly to great altitude.- But with one draw back, I found it hard to control and was afraid of crashing heavily into buildings and stuff, which I often did. - Sometimes I had good control, other times I did not. Imagine those video games of you learning to control something for the first time, and how erratic things can get. So why you may ask - would I want to have it come true? Well it would be fun if I could control my range and stability, rather then being like someone flying a drone for the first time. Imagine the views and perspective I could witness - instead of having to be onboard an aircraft. Yes it would be awesome

Depression lies. It taught me to measure myself by my flaws and failures, with almost no weight given to my virtues and successes. Just today, I read a great quote: “Every day, write down the good stuff. Read it back, and you will see a wonderful life.” On that note, one of my most significant life successes was learning to recognize the lies that depression tells me. Some of my other significant successes: Going back to college full-time at age 30 to change careers. Being elected President of the Student Dietetic Association by people 5–10 years younger than me, and graduating summa cum laude.Writing and publishing a novel (and crossing that off my bucket list).Surviving sudden, unexpected single-motherhood to a three-year-old, a two-year-old, and a newborn. Not merely surviving, but thriving in a rewarding new job, new home, new community, and eventually, a wonderful new relationship with the love of my life.

Counting backwards, my biggest milestones are: Living long enough to possibly reach 90 in two years. Knowing that the first of my grandchildren has graduated from college. Remarrying after the death of my first two husbands and being smart enough not to remarry after the death of my third husband. Receiving three pensions when I retired. Graduating from college at 53, Working as a freelance social reporter and photographer until I was 73 years old and retired to care for my fatally ill husband. Raising two children by my deceased husband along with four children of my second husband’s deceased wife and giving birth to my second husband’s last child. Being accepted to work in several positions formerly occupied by men. Managing to keep my full time job while dealing with the deaths of my parents within six months of each other. This included going to court to get conservatorship of my newly widowed mother, Winning an art scholarship to an American summer art school in France. Giving birth to three living children despite having a septate uterus.

My crowning achievement has been “starting the YUWMAHN REVOLUTION” … All around the world, people are realising that we would all be better off if we gathered in small like-minded groups who lived in harmony and became self-sufficient rather than gather in huge cities that only serve the wheels of industry and you have to put up with all sorts. In small groups we can grow our own food and become largely self-sufficient. Happiness is easier when you have no stress and don’t have to work much because you own everything… So the houses are built against the inside of a wall that surrounds the city so outsiders can’t just wander through and create problems. The entire plan is discussed at length in my first book “Journey to Yuwmah”… and more details about different aspects are found in subsequent books …

When I was 29 American Motors opened 4 new dealerships, the only four where they owned the ground and building. The first three were opened by experienced car people. I had no auto dealership experience but was trained by Booz-Allen-Hamilton in an intensive 10 week course on dealership management. I personally hired every single one of my initial employees. The first three dealerships opened by the experienced car people lost an average of $50,000 per month in their first three months of operation. My people broke my dealership even in the third month of operation. One of the highlights of my working life~!

As of now I have only completed a little part of my life, so I have not much experience. But during this period I have learned a lot from my life. What is your biggest achievement in life? As I think there is no other alternative of internal satisfaction for achievements. In my case it was my internal pleasure that I felt and it's the biggest achievement in my life. During my classroom training one day I got the information that there is an employee who is admitted in hospital and his situation is very serious. He was lacking platelets in blood. There needed a person who can donate his blood and whose blood group must be O positive. Since then I was in a group of my friends. Me and my two other friends decided to go. We travelled for nearly four hours by car and reached Kolkata. After certain tests I donated my blood. Before and during donation period I was treated very well. For approximately one hour I lied on the bed. After donation I was given some light food by hospital staffs. I felt a little weakness too but I was internally very happy.  Thanks for reading :)

After critical illness and several years of retirement, I reached the milestone of having the paradigm that it is MY time now. I no longer feel guilt for scaling back my participation in politics because of stress, I have scaled back my philanthropy due to my retirement income. It is the young people’s world and their time to run it. I don’t mince words and have become intolerant of intolerance. I am free to be ME; free to be honest instead of worrying about repercussions. I am not afraid of anything; it must be terrible to be so afraid of everything that you have to carry a weapon. Being an oldtimer, I can double down on humor because I am no longer seen as a physical threat to anyone. And finally, I am FEELING a kernel of wisdom. I am so amazingly fortunate that I can’t express it.

I have lived a hard, sad, tough, lonely life and never had lots of money. I worked since I was 11 years old - I wanted to buy my mother a birthday present. I had to retire in my late 50’s, after my husband passed of cancer, due to medical problems and many surgeries. Somehow, looking back, against impossible odds, I lived in my own home and the mortgage was paid in four years (long story for another time), and I traveled - something which was so important to me. I saw 33 countries and would have liked to see l00. But what I am most proud of, among many accomplishments, is the fact that I found my life’s passion to be animals and I devoted 50 years (I am 86 and still doing the job) of my life to animal welfare from a local to international level. In the beginning years, I worked in corporate executive America and did my animal work nights and weekends. When I became disabled 12 years ago, I turned to the computer to help as I could not walk any longer. I know I have helped hundreds of animals along the way. But, I have never, ever met anyone who is so dedicated as to devote 50 years of their lifetime - non-stop - to animal welfare. People love animals and many do wonders for them but they come and go or burn out. This work is heartbreaking but as long as there is a breath in me, I will continue to try to help them.
